items.content:
Business Development Representative at CVEDIA

Remote | International

In this role, you will have the opportunity of working in a team of exceptionally talented and driven individuals who are all making a massive impact on our business. There is no micromanaging or babysitting at CVEDIA, everyone here drives their own ideas all the way from start to finish, everyone is given an equal opportunity to flourish and see the fruits of their labour.

Responsibilities Include
  • Creative prospecting for new markets, accounts and leads
  • Managing and optimize the inbound lead pipeline
  • Active cold outreach to targeted accounts
  • Collaborating with internal stakeholders and customers to recognize and develop new market opportunities
  • Maintaining a high level of attention to detail and precision in communication
Key Qualifications Include
  • Passion for working in a fully virtually distributed remote startup environment
  • Enthusiasm to contribute to a rapidly growing and innovative company culture
  • Intelligence and ability to quickly establish credibility with a technical buyer
What We Offer
  • Fully distributed team, located in 19 countries
  • 4 weeks paid holiday per year
  • Yearly team meetup – this year we went to Portugal!
  • Anti-discriminatory company culture – we won’t discount you for things like needing to pick your kids up from school, your age, your ethnicity, or your gender
  • An excited, communicative, and helpful team – we keep our work environment positive, but we also place importance on honesty
Our Values

1. Passion – We need both energy and passion to develop cutting edge AI. To succeed at CVEDIA, you’ll need to have a strong investment in both your career and the role of AI in the future of the planet.

2. Commitment – CVEDIA has the opposite of a “quick-n-dirty” mentality. Every aspect of our technology has been meticulously built, and is always the product of very hard work.

3. Autonomy – Carrying confidence in the work we do individually is required to work at the pace that we do as a team. Academic research, tutorials, and even creating our own solutions with the tools we have are all on the board during a regular day’s work.

4. Joy – It’s one of our greatest strengths to bring joy and excitement into our workplace. We carry this energy into meetings, project planning, and our dedication to our work, and focus on work that feels meaningful.

5. Communication – Honest discussions are imperative to the flow of work and ideas. Team members need to be able to effectively communicate complex ideas to those who don’t work in their field. It’s a regular occurrence to spontaneously discuss plans and ideas with any team member on the fly, including our CEO or CTO. Each team member is respected equally and acts as a valuable contributor.

How to Apply
  • Please state in the subject the job position you are applying for
  • Please mention your city and country of residence in your application
  • English applications only – a professional speaking and writing command of English is required for this role
  • Due to time zone difficulties, we’re currently only accepting applicants in North America or European timezones.

For more information about us and videos of our work, please check out CVEDIA.COM

Apply for job

items.content:
Who are we?


Formisimo is an award-winning start-up based in Manchester. We were incubated at Europe’s leading startup accelerator Seedcamp, and we’re used by thousands of companies Worldwide including Capital One, Sainsbury's Bank, Uber, The New Zealand Government and Experian.


Formisimo is changing the way that companies design online forms and checkouts. Using market-leading technology, we help online brands understand their website visitors and how they engage with online forms. We give them the insight they need to improve their online user experience and help transform their businesses as a result.


What to expect



  • Working alongside a co-founder to be the first point of contact for our international Enterprise client base - helping them get set up with our product and ensuring they continue to get huge value from it in the long term

  • You'll be building strong, long term relationships with our clients, and the companies they work in. We aim to make our clients lives easier and to help our clients' companies grow

  • You’ll also understand that onboarding customers is a vital part of the experience of using a product and so everything within your power to ensure our customers love our product

  • Getting to know a technical product inside out, and be able to troubleshoot quickly and effectively for new customers (full training on this will be provided)

  • Your ideas to be taken seriously and valued

  • To work with talented and motivated people

  • To have the space and autonomy to manage your own workload and priorities, and be able to enact your ideas and improve on our current way of doing things

  • All the incredible experiences of working at a startup - dizzying highs, and buckle-down-lows, but never boring

  • A focussed, productive work environment, but not a stressful one


Responsibilities


The Account Manager is the primary point of contact for our customers and is the human face of our fantastic product, Zuko. We’re proud of our customer service, and it’s a reason why our clients work with us and stay with us long term. You’ll manage all client relationships and own the entire customer life cycle post-sale, including:



  • Onboarding new clients and users, helping them understand how to get the most from our platform

  • Be the first point of contact for technical issues, solving them where possible, or escalating larger issues to the technical team

  • Hold regular workshops and update calls with clients to ensure they understand their data, have noticed any new trends and ensure they are using the product to its full potential

  • Manage and own retention and upselling - it will be your responsibility to ensure customers see value in the product and want to continue to benefit from it

  • All billing and invoicing for clients

  • Being the voice of the customer inside Formisimo, helping our product development team understand the needs and wants of our clients and help shape the future functionality of our platform.

  • Opportunities to write and input into content related to our platform and our area of expertise, online forms and how to make them better.


Who are you?



  • You’re a great people person, with an ability to create and nurture relationships quickly and maintain those relationships over time

  • You have extremely capable communication skills, both written and verbal. We communicate with our customers both via Intercom, email and on calls and in-person

  • You have strong attention to detail - typos in emails will annoy you

  • You are great at time management - often you’ll be juggling multiple clients and many urgent issues and tasks

  • You’re a self-starter and will look to be constantly improving how you work and not be afraid to voice opinions about how processes and approaches could be improved

  • You will be excited about joining an early-stage startup, and the potential to grow with Formisimo

  • You are comfortable working in an environment not restricted by excessive processes and clear job roles - you’ll often be doing tasks for the first time and building a process as you go

  • You’ll not be afraid of getting stuck into a technical product. Full training will be provided, but you will be helping customers install and troubleshoot code on their site.


Experience



  • Extensive experience working in a fast-paced, client-facing environment

  • Working with large (Enterprise) organisations in a previous role would be beneficial (Previous work within an agency on client work will be a huge plus)

  • Be adept at managing multiple priorities

  • You will have dealt with both positive and challenging client situations, and be adept at understanding a customer's needs and responding accordingly

  • You’ll have a track record of building relationships with customers keeping in regular contact with them, and getting to understand their businesses and their problems

  • Familiarity with CRMs and time management tools such as Intercom, Trello and Slack


What we offer



  • Flexible working hours and remote working - our team structure their days around what works for them, including those with families

  • A new device of your choice (PC/Windows Laptop/Macbook)

  • Autonomy, ownership and a flat management structure mean your opinions will be listened to and you’ll have a big impact from the start

  • Free car parking

  • Weekly company breakfasts, twice-annual team nights that aren't alcohol focused

  • A high level of company transparency - salaries, company profit and loss, budgets and more are all shared in our open and honest working environment

  • A close-knit, focussed and productive team

  • Annual share-option bonus scheme

  • Work with leading brands like Capital One, Experian and DFS

  • Location: MediaCity, Salford, UK

  • Salary: £35k (+ share options)

items.content:
Business Development Representative

CVEDIA is a funded AI company that develops deep learning solutions for some of the largest organizations on the planet. We develop and license solutions for computer vision systems. CVEDIA is seeking an ambitious and intelligent Business Development Representative to contribute to our growth. This position will be responsible for developing new business across verticals including ADAS/AD, Agricultural, Industrial and Infrastructure.

In this role, you will have the opportunity of working in a team of exceptionally talented and driven individuals who are all making a massive impact on our business. There is no micromanaging or babysitting at CVEDIA, everyone here drives their own ideas all the way from start to finish, everyone is given an equal opportunity to flourish and see the fruits of their labour.

Responsibilities Include


  • Creative prospecting for new markets, accounts and leads
  • Managing and optimize the inbound lead pipeline
  • Active cold outreach to targeted accounts
  • Collaborating with internal stakeholders and customers to recognize and develop new market opportunities
  • Maintaining a high level of attention to detail and precision in communication

Key Qualifications Include


  • Passion for working in a fully virtually distributed remote startup environment
  • Enthusiasm to contribute to a rapidly growing and innovative company culture
  • Intelligence and ability to quickly establish credibility with a technical buyer

What We Offer


  • Fully distributed team, located in 19 countries
  • 4 weeks paid holiday per year
  • Yearly team meetup - this year we went to Portugal!
  • Anti-discriminatory company culture - we won’t discount you for things like needing to pick your kids up from school, your age, your ethnicity, or your gender
  • An excited, communicative, and helpful team - we keep our work environment positive, but we also place importance on honesty

Our Values

1. Passion - We need both energy and passion to develop cutting edge AI. To succeed at CVEDIA, you’ll need to have a strong investment in both your career and the role of AI in the future of the planet.

2. Commitment - CVEDIA has the opposite of a "quick-n-dirty" mentality. Every aspect of our technology has been meticulously built, and is always the product of very hard work.

3. Autonomy - Carrying confidence in the work we do individually is required to work at the pace that we do as a team. Academic research, tutorials, and even creating our own solutions with the tools we have are all on the board during a regular day's work.

4. Joy - It's one of our greatest strengths to bring joy and excitement into our workplace. We carry this energy into meetings, project planning, and our dedication to our work, and focus on work that feels meaningful.

5. Communication - Honest discussions are imperative to the flow of work and ideas. Team members need to be able to effectively communicate complex ideas to those who don’t work in their field. It's a regular occurrence to spontaneously discuss plans and ideas with any team member on the fly, including our CEO or CTO. Each team member is respected equally and acts as a valuable contributor.



How to Apply


  • Please state in the subject the job position you are applying for
  • Please mention your city and country of residence in your application
  • English applications only - a professional speaking and writing command of English is required for this role
  • Due to time zone difficulties, we’re currently only accepting applicants in North America or European timezones.

For more information about us and videos of our work, please check out CVEDIA.COM

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=22, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Account Executive

CVEDIA is a funded AI company that develops deep learning solutions for some of the largest organisations on the planet. We develop and license solutions for computer vision systems. CVEDIA is seeking an ambitious and intelligent Account Executive to contribute to our growth. This position will be responsible for developing new business across verticals including ADAS/AD, Agricultural, Industrial and Infrastructure.

In this role, you will have the opportunity of working in a team of exceptionally talented and driven individuals who are all making a massive impact on our business. There is no micromanaging or babysitting at CVEDIA, everyone here drives their own ideas all the way from start to finish, everyone is given an equal opportunity to flourish and see the fruits of their labour.

Responsibilities Include


  • Effectively building and managing a pipeline of 30 to 50 active opportunities
  • Closing of client contracts ranging in size from $50k to $1 Million a year in ARR
  • Collaborating with internal stakeholders and customers to recognize and develop new market opportunities
  • Exploring creative licensing opportunities and championing their success
  • Accurate forecasting of pipeline and consistent delivery of quota
  • Maintaining a high level of attention to detail and precision in communication

Key Qualifications Include


  • Proof of meeting and exceeding sales goals
  • Ability to deliver presentations and speak to technical capabilities of the solution
  • Passion for working in a fully virtually distributed remote startup environment
  • Enthusiasm to contribute to a rapidly growing and innovative company culture
  • Intelligence and ability to quickly establish credibility with a technical buyer

What We Offer


  • Fully distributed team, located in 19 countries
  • 4 weeks paid holiday per year
  • Yearly team meetup - this year we went to Portugal!
  • Anti-discriminatory company culture - we won’t discount you for things like needing to pick your kids up from school, your age, your ethnicity, or your gender

items.title: Inbound Sales Representative - Work From Home
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
*Licensed Inbound Sales Representative - Work From Home - Houston, TX (REQUIRED: must live within 60 miles of Houston, TX)*
We are seeking those that have an active insurance license to join our team as a inbound sales rep working remotely from your home. On our team, you'll be taking inbound calls from customers interested in buying insurance.*NO COLD CALLING!*
*.
We'll provide you with office equipment and training virtually so that you can feel confident you're providing the best possible customer service while still in a work from home environment. As the voice of Progressive to our customers, you'll explain policy coverage and sell insurance products and services. You'll have the support of a virtual, collaborative team, which includes ongoing coaching and development.
*2019 Training Start Dates & Schedule:*
*.Start Date: November 4, 2019 or January 27, 2020*
*.Training Hours:*Monday - Friday, 10:00am - 6:45pm (EST)
*.Work Schedule Options:*Choose from 3 schedule options with start times between 8:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. local time including one weekend day
*Duties & Responsibilities:*
* Build trust by understanding the unique needs of our customers, and offering the best insurance solutions to meet those needs
* Educate customers on our insurance products and services while identifying opportunities to sell additional products
*.
*Qualifications:*
* Must live within 60 miles of Houston, TX
* Active Personal Lines or Property & Casualty (P&C) license
* One or more years of college education or relevant work experience
* Work or educational experience must include:
o Customer service, sales and/or influencing others
o Fast paced and changing environment
o Multitasking and time management skills
o Effectively communicating verbally and in writing
o Computer skills
*Prefer previous remote work experience and/or contact center experience*
*.
*Pay Rate: $16.00 -$19.00 per hour*, plus:
* Additional 10% shift differential pay when you work evenings or weekends
* Top performance awards and contests with cash payouts
*Benefits & Perks:*
Progressive offers the confidence and stability that comes with working for a growing, always evolving organization. Progressive employees also benefit from:
* Annual gainshare bonus of up to 16% of your salary; Progressive rewards each of us with an annual bonus based on company performance
* 401k which includes dollar-for-dollar company match of up to 6%
* Paid training, tuition assistance and career development
* Diverse, welcoming culture with Employee Resource Groups
* Dedication to work/life balance including beginning to earn paid time off after your first two weeks
* Wellness program with discounts & rewards and the standard benefits (medical, dental, vision)
*Work From Home Office Details:*
* Designated workspace that is free from noise and other distractions and allows for dedicated focus
* Remote office Internet connection should be via DSL or Cable Modem with minimum speed of 1mbps down and 0.5mbps up.
* Your computer or Router should be physically connected to the modem by a cable. No wireless connection
* All Progressive hardware you receive needs to be connected to a surge protector
*Apply Today!*
Equal Opportunity Employer
VIRTUALINBOUNDSALES
*Job:*.*Contact Center*
*Title:*.Inbound Sales Representative - Work From Home*
*Location:*.Texas-Houston*
*Requisition ID:*.160973*

items.title: Account Manager - Remote
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=8, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
BairesDev is the largest software development company in the Americas. With more than 1000 employees working on different projects around the world and a sustained annual growth of over 50% - number 561 in the ranking according to Inc.com, in the United States -, BairesDev has positioned itself as a leader in the software industry, guiding the digital transformation of some of the top companies in the world, such as Google, Rolls-Royce, Pinterest, IBM, Motorola & Viacom.

Recognized by Clutch.co as Top B2B Company, the company has offices in the United States, Europe, and Latin America and offers an exceptional work environment in which employees can shine and thrive, working in multicultural teams, with flexible schedules and endless growth opportunities.

We are looking for Account Managers to join our Client Services Team and help spearhead our growth.
As an Account Manager, you will play a critical and active role in the day-to-day operations. This is an excellent opportunity to be one of the key members of our Client Services team and position yourself for unique career growth opportunities.

Main activities:
- Conduct in-depth research on prospects.
- Using proprietary Sales Tools to contact and convert leads into clients.
- Contacting potential clients via email to establish rapport and set up meetings.
- Reach out by phone and hold quality conversations to generate qualified prospects.
- Work closely and collaboratively to develop and implement appropriate prospect strategies and plans.
- Work internally with the Sales Management and Marketing teams to ensure proper quality and quantity of presentations.
- Provide complete and appropriate solutions to boost revenue growth and profitability.
- Present, promote, and sell services using solid arguments to existing and prospective customers.
- Establish, develop, and maintain positive business and customer relationships

What are we looking for:

- Proven work experience as an Account Manager.
- Must be highly motivated, flexible, and service-oriented.
- Must be familiar with CRM practices, along with the ability to build productive business professional relationships.
- Goal-oriented, driven and experienced in networking with and influencing decision-makers.
- Excellent selling, communication, and negotiation skills.
- Prioritizing, time management, and organizational skills.
- Thorough understanding of marketing and negotiating techniques.
- Experience in opening doors to new opportunities.
- Fast learner and passionate for sales.
- A network of potential clients in the IT industry or other verticals is a big plus.

Perks:

- Excellent compensation plan above the market average.
- Medical, dental, and vision coverage for full-time employees and dependents.
- Possibility to work from anywhere.
- Flexible schedule.
- Paid training.
- Paid parental leave for both parents.
- Extensive development opportunities.

If you are interested in being part of a team composed of the best professionals and working 100% goal-oriented in an innovative environment, but with the structure and resources of a multinational market leader, do not hesitate to apply!

- provided by Dice

items.title: Systems Consultant (Sales Engineer), Global Accounts, Remote
items.content:
Senior Presales Systems Engineer

Competitive salary

Dell provides the technology that transforms the way we all work and live. But we are more than a technology company - we are a people company. We inspire, challenge and respect every one of our over 100,000 employees. We also provide them with unparalleled growth and development opportunities.

Our field sales professionals rely on proactive technical support during the sales process - and our expert Systems Engineering team always steps up to the mark. We lead the development and implementation of complex and specialized products, applications, services and solutions. From delivering sales presentations and product demonstrations, to developing detailed installations or system integration plans, we ensure customers get the innovative, relevant, interoperable solutions they need.
Key Responsibilities
  • At this level, supports highly complex and high value accounts exercising wide latitude to determine objectives and approaches
  • Gains access and manages relationships with senior level executives and IT decision makers Devises new approaches/methods to selling enterprise/client products and services
  • Verifies operability of highly complex product and service configuration within the customer's environment that addresses critical issues Identifies and allocates roles and responsibilities required to support account team
  • Synthesizes market, industry and competitor data to anticipate how external factors will influence the position of the solution and makes decisions that impact the long term success of the business
  • Creates formal networks internally and externally with industry experts and key decision makers
  • Leverages third-party and/or the Channel to create and position the solution
  • Assumes leadership role in analyzing requirements and performing advanced systems integration and providing technical expertise to design and implement solution across breadth of Dell and third-party products and services
  • Senior level sales engineer with expert understanding of complex products and services portfolio
  • Leveraged as coach/mentor to others
  • Provides customer/industry/market insight to internal leaders and cross-functional groups
  • Qualifies the most complex sales opportunities in the terms of customer technical requirements, competition, decision making process and funding
  • Presents the design and value of proposed solution and business case to customers, prospects and management at the executive level


Essential Requirements:
  • Typically requires 12+ years of related experience with a Bachelor's degree
  • Assists in formulating the customer's long- term strategic vision and our role as a strategic partner Influences the future development of enterprise/client technology, products, and services
  • Expected to be part of the overall product development cycle Works with strategic planning teams to define future directions and strategies for products and services


Benefits
We offer highly competitive salaries, bonus programs, world-class benefits, and unparalleled growth and development opportunities - all to create a compelling and rewarding work environment.

If you have the technical skills to take our sales to the next level, this is your opportunity to develop with Dell.

Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Learn more about Diversity and Inclusion at Dell here .
- provided by Dice

items.title: Sales Representative
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(europ, european, europeanunion)
items.content:
Job Description


We’re seeking a qualified, ambitious and independent Sales Manager to engage and convert London based tech start-up owners who are interested in hiring remote staff.


Our ideal salesperson knows how to build a sales process, and excels at generating leads, building relationships, and closing deals. We’re seeking an energetic, communicative, proactive and organized salesperson who can showcase our offerings in a compelling way. Often tasked with giving presentations, attending networking events, or doing outreach, it’s essential that our salesperson be approachable and professional.


Objectives of this Role


Represent our company, with a comprehensive understanding of our offerings
Building and executing a sales strategy for our company
Writing a sales script for Sales Specialists
Report weekly, monthly
Generate leads and commit to customer service by building relationships
Adjust sales techniques based on interactions and results in the field
Perform an incisive and insightful market and competitive research
 


Daily and Monthly Responsibilities


Qualify, develop, and maintain thorough company and product knowledge, research consumer needs, and identify how our solutions can meet them
Generate leads and maintaining an accurate client base on our CRM platform, and developing an active customer base
Make cold calls or perform warm outreach, putting outside-the-box thinking to work to develop new and unique sales tactics
 


Skills and Qualifications Required


2-3 years in sales within the service industry
Excellent communication, interpersonal, telephone, and organizational skills
Experience working with CRM platforms
Experience with generating leads and closing deals
Ability to travel for face to face meeting with potential clients on a daily basis
Preferred Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree
The proven success rate at levels above quotas
Strong organizational skills
 


Working experience in recruitment, or workforce would be an advantage


About us 


Remote Bob is connecting remote employees from Croatia with London based start-ups. We have a team in London and in Croatia, our co-founders are both serial entrepreneurs with an MBA. 


We are enabling London based start-ups to outsource their projects and departments without
compromising on quality. Here, in Remote Bob, we can reassure all our clients that the delivered work will be exceptional. Our remote employees are based in the EU, and we are offering local support; recruitment, people management, training, quality check, and payroll. With our help, working with a remote team has never been easier! 


Website: www.remotebob.co.uk

items.title: Sales & Marketing Executive
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
We are looking for a marketing and sales executive intern to join our small, but experienced team working partly from our office in London and partly remotely. The role requires capability for working independently and strong digital and content writing skills. 


 

On a day-to-day basis expect to;



  • Edit and publish blog posts - it is an advantage if you like to write your own too

  • Site user customer service work

  • Measure, monitor and analyse past performance of campaigns

  • Manage the communication and processes of our partnership campaigns

  • Do bits and bobs of admin




Requirements



  • A commitment to high-quality output and service, with an eye for detail.

  • Analytical mind, and good with analysing data.

  • Excellent interpersonal / communication skills.

  • Willingness to be flexible, agile

  • A commitment to high-quality output and service, with an eye for detail.

  • Interested in charitable giving/corporate social responsibility as a topic

  • Experience in using digital tools e.g. email systems, scheduling tools, blog post systems

  • Excellent english - native requirement


Bonus requirements



  • Interest and skills to create content (blogs, tutorials, videos)




Benefits



  • Agile, flexible startup working environment 

  • Working with highly experienced partners who will also give training

  • Gaining not only experience, but also contacts and network.

  • Working partly remotely

  • Opportunity to participate in start-up events and meetups as a representative of whatCharity

items.title: Outbound Sales Representative
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR( australia, japan, newzealand)
DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(europ, european, europeanunion)
items.content:
Outbound Sales Representative at Day Translations

Remote | International

Location: Remote Worldwide
Category: Sales
Job Type: Full-Time
Job Desc:

Day Translations is a global translation and interpreting company. We help improve worldwide communication through accurate, localized translations, interpretation and outsourcing services, and a wide variety of tailored language solutions for individuals, organizations, and businesses of all sizes.

About the Outbound Sales Representative position

Position type: Full-time
Location: Remote job (America, Europe, Middle East, Australia, and Asia)
Reports to: CEO

Day Translations is looking for an energetic, focus, and self-directed sales representative that can prospect and qualify new sale leads for our various language services and our Day Interpreting Application. At Day Translations we are not just focused on selling but creating new and long-term business relationships with our prospects and clients. We are looking for closers who also pride themselves on their integrity and work ethic.

Job Duties and responsibilities:

  • Meet and / or exceed sale quotas.
  • Prospect and qualify new sales leads.
  • Develop and deliver presentations of our services and products.
  • Schedule meetings and presentations with prospects.
  • Coordinate with other team members and departments to optimize the sales effort.
  • Maintain a well-develop pipeline and strong ongoing relationships with prospects.

Requirements:

  • 2+ years of experience in sales, marketing or related field.
  • Experience in the Language Service Industry is preferred.
  • A Bachelor’s Degree in business, marketing or related field is preferred.
  • Familiar with CRM and sales software in order to generate leads and analyze the statistics of sales and make data-driven decisions.
  • Ability to flourish with minimal guidance, be proactive, and handle uncertainty.
  • Strong decision-making, attention to detail, organizational and skills.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills in English (native or C1 level) and fluent in a foreign language.

Candidates should be prepared to take additional tests/interviews.

Apply for job

items.title: Business Development Rep
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR( australia, japan, newzealand)

items.content:
Business Development Rep at sMedia

Remote | Freelance
Business Developer Coordinator

sMedia is North America’s leading digital tech company for automotive dealerships.

Over 650 dealerships across North America partner with sMedia to build traffic, maximize engagement, and drive leads and sales.

We analyze website visitors online body language for buying intent, predict future sales from future behavior, and deploy proprietary AI – driven advertising to increase dealership sales.

We are looking for experienced Business Development Reps that can initiate demos between our Dealer Specialists and potential customers.

This position is a freelance / part time position starting at 15-25 hours per week. Our general calling hours are between 8 AM & 5 PM CST, Monday through Friday.

Responsibilities:
  • Support our Dealer Specialist team by initiating contact (via phone) with prospective customers to generate leads (dealerships throughout North America)
  • Call using scripts to provide information about sMedia, our solutions and how they can benefit the dealership
  • Set up demos for the Dealer Specialist team through google calendar and calend.ly
  • Strive to provide every potential customer with a great experience when working with them
  • Establishing effective relationships with potential customers via phone and email
  • Handling general inquiries and provide appropriate feedback to the Dealer Specialists
Skills & Qualifications:
  • Tech Savvy,  needs to be able to operate in a fast paced tech space
  • Great personality and comfortable on the phone cold calling potential customers
  • Strong communication skills
  • Previous sales experience an asset
  • Strong listening skills
  • Strong customer relationship skills with excellent verbal and written skills
  • Highly organized with great attention to detail
  • Automotive and dealership experience preferred
What It Means To Be Successful In This Position?
  • Make active contributions to achieve team goals and successes
  • Proactive Approach – self starter that finds ways to increase efficiencies
  • Strong team player, ability to build positive and collaborative relationships within the organization and with customer personnel

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Apply to: stephanie@smedia.ca
Locations: Canada, USA, England, Australia
Apply for job

items.title: Work From Home Reservation Sales Representative - Prescott Valley
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=16, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Overview

Enterprise Holdings (the parent company of Enterprise Rent-A-Car, Alamo Rent a Car and National Car Rental) is looking to add virtual agents to our Contact Centers Reservations Sales team!

If you
  • Are an outgoing, sales-minded expert, skilled in utilizing effective selling techniques to turn customer calls into confirmed reservations
  • Are able to successfully follow a sales strategy to overcome customer objections and maximize revenue
  • Are able to consistently apply feedback provided
  • Communicate effectively with a wide range of callers and create and maintain customer loyalty
  • Can input detailed information into the appropriate reservation system accurately and efficiently
  • Enjoy a sales-oriented culture, while working from the comfort of home
    • Then this may be the perfect opportunity youve been searching for!

    Outstanding Pay: This position offers competitive pay at $14.00/hour plus commission and full-time benefits.

    Outstanding Pay:

    Schedule Requirements:To best serve the needs of our customers, our Reservations Sales team is available until 10pm central time, offering full-time schedules. Start times range between 11a-1:30p CST. Schedules include working one weekend day per week and holidays. (Do not apply if this schedule will not work for you)

    Schedule Requirements:
  • Hired employees will be shipped a key fob to the address provided on the application. The address on your application must be your current, accurate permanent address.
  • Please be sure to verify that your mailing address in our system is your primary address where you can receive equipment. Make sure you add the apartment number (if any). PO Boxes are not supported; we must have a physical address on file for you.

    • Responsibilities

  • Sales Representatives must be able to handle 80-100 incoming back to back calls per day and talk with potential customers across multiple states and time zones and brands
  • Book quality reservations for our locations worldwide
  • Receive feedback from managers and improve call quality by applying feedback given
  • Efficiently guide conversations and apply sales techniques to convert calls into reservations
  • Provide excellent customer service to customers
  • Maintain a courteous and pleasant demeanor while speaking with external and internal customers
  • Strive to exceed sales targets take appropriate steps to meet monthly personal and department sales goals (based on bookings, revenue, etc.)
  • Provide timely and accurate information reflecting a customer-oriented image for the company
  • Follow sales techniques to maximize revenue
  • Handle multiple tasks (i.e., talking with customers while accessing information in a computer)
  • Maintain, at a minimum, target levels of productivity and performance
  • Locate and interpret complex information from a number of databases
  • Adapt to the needs of individual callers
  • Accept repetitive work tasks performed in a confined work area
  • Maintain a regular and reliable level of attendance and punctuality
  • Follow schedule to meet business needs
    • Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans

    Qualifications

    Must currently live in the state ofArizona Must currently live in Prescott, AZ, or the immediate surrounding area (applicants not in the surrounding area will not be considered)
  • One year of sales or customer service experience required
  • Previous experience working in a call center environment preferred
  • Previous experience working in a position with minimum performance goals or minimum sales goals and/or a commission based pay structure preferred
  • Previous experience working from home preferred
  • Permanent residence with a defined working space that is clean, ventilated, quiet,andfree of distractions
  • Ability to participate and complete mandatory training for 3 weeks M-F from 9-5:30pm CST
  • Ability to complete I-9 work authorization paperwork in person
  • Must be willing to work a full time schedule (40 hours/week), with start times between 11am-1:30pmCentral Time Zone, including one weekend day per week and holidays
  • Must be willing to accept a non-negotiable starting pay of $14.00/hour
  • Must be authorized to work in the United States and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future
  • Must be at least 18 years old

    • Technical Qualifications:

  • Must have a computer/PC (No MACs) with compatible OS versions: Windows 8, 8.1, or Windows 10
  • Computer/PC must be capable of downloading/installing/accessing company network
  • Must have a computer USB headset with microphone to be used during training
  • Must have a separate modem
  • Must have a stand-alone router withgigabit speed connection via Ethernet cable
  • Must have reliable, consistent, responsive, and timely high-speed internet access provided by a cable or fiber provider (no DSL, satellite or wireless)

    • *Enterprise reserves the right to verify that your PC and internet meets or exceeds these requirements throughout the training period.

    *Applicants must meet all technical qualifications at the time of application.

    Learn about Enterprise Holdings Work from Home Contact Center opportunities.

    When Jack Taylor founded Enterprise, his vision was formalized into eight core values that are the guiding force behind how we do business.

    From employee benefits and referral bonuses to retirement options and discounts on rentals and purchases, Enterprise Holdings has you covered.

items.title: Codeless: Agency Account Managers [100% Remote]
items.content:
Agency Account Managers [100% Remote]

We're a content production company that helps high-growth companies scale. We produce hundreds of articles each month, with dozens of writers (both full-time and contract) spread out all over the world. We're fully remote, so you’re free to work whatever hours you want (as long as some overlap with your clients).

Here's a rough list of typical activities you’d face from week to week:

- Coordinating new work with clients
- Assigning new work
- Coordinating work with specialists (writers) and editors based on deadlines (for outlines, drafts, edits, etc.)
- Some QA work (things like light copy edits, checking plagiarism, etc.) to make sure deliverables (pieces of content) meet client specs
- Reporting/updating progress to client
- Managing capacity to see if we need to test/hire new writers
- Coordinating new test writers, vetting quality, etc.

In other words, you're like a part-account executive to help clients and part-project manager, making sure we're delivering everything on time and under budget.

If interested, please apply here: https://getcodeless.com/account-management/

We’re looking for good people, who can think logically and are detail-oriented. So please answer the application in full... ;)

items.title: Paid internship: Business Development Associate - Germany focus
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
KeyNest is a fast-growing global network of shops where Airbnb hosts and Property Managers can securely store their keys so that their guests / cleaners / contractors can pick them up whenever is convenient for them.

We are a global partner of Airbnb and have checked-in more than 100,000 guests. We already have a presence in 8 countries and are now launching in the DACH region. 


To make this a success, we’re looking for an ambitious International Business Development Associate to grow our network of KeyNest Stores in Germany, Austria and Switzerland and help us with our overall strategy for the DACH region.

This is a paid 4-6-months internship based in London.

The role:
• Recruit new Stores to join the KeyNest partner programme in Germany, Austria and Switzerland
• Assist with customer requests
• Build, manage and maintain a sales pipeline to follow up on leads
• Liaise with our international customers to find the best suitable partner
• Train and/or mystery shop our partner Stores where required in London and remotely for international partner Stores
• Demonstrate an in-depth knowledge of our product offering to customers


Who we are looking for:
• Excellent communication and outgoing personality
• Available to travel extensively in and around London and occasionally outside / international
• Pro-active, self-motivated and work well in a team environment style
• Native German speaker + fluent English required (company language is English), knowledge of other languages a plus
• Experience as an Airbnb host / guest is a plus
• Available for 4 months minimum


What we offer:
• Weekly salary payment
• Unique chance to make your mark in a dynamic and very fast-growing company shaking up the sharing economy
• Sales training to help you succeed in your role
• Possibility to be hired full-time or to continue working remotely whilst at university
• Central London office


If you want to join the KeyNest team, please get in touch at careers@keynest.com – we look forward to meeting you.

items.title: Sales Associate
items.content:
Overview


Settled was founded on the belief that there needs to be a progressive change in the real-estate sector. We're on a mission to put a smile on the faces of everyone buying or selling a home by building next-generation products and software.


As well as being led by former Google execs, Settled is venture capital backed by firms including 500.co, Piton Capital, Accelerated Digital Ventures and Connect Ventures. We're at that exciting stage where our business is growing rapidly and we're focused on building a team who'll be part of our journey for the years ahead.


People are at the heart of everything we do and we spend a lot of time thinking about our team and our culture. We love working with smart, creative thinkers who are passionate about collaborating and making a difference.


The Sales Associate will work to shape the strategy for and help deliver Settled’s ambitious sales and growth targets. Working cross-functionally with Growth, Operations, and Product, they will drive optimisation of the sales funnels whilst managing their own pipeline.


Responsibilities



  • Successful management of a sales pipeline. What this means specifically in the current model:

    • Managing the lead relationship, from qualification to closing. 

    • Handling inbound sales enquiries via phone, email, and live chat.

    • Being the first point of contact for all seller leads after they’ve signed up to Settled, and buyer leads after they’ve shown interest in a Settled home.

    • Managing a smooth transition to relationship managers post lead-close.



  • Identifying any pipeline inefficiencies and removing any bottlenecks.

  • Working with the Head of Growth and an extensive understanding of both Settled’s seller and buyer funnels they will drive optimisation to maximise conversion.

  • Providing input and shaping sales strategy for both new and existing markets.


Requirements



  • 1-2 years experience in B2C sales, someone ideally looking to take the next step in their career, looking for more responsibility and wanting to make a real influence in the industry

  • Dedication, passion, commitment and hard-work goes a long way with us!

  • A real team-player, we don't work in silos and advocate transparency

  • An analytical mindset, knowing the importance of data-driven decisions and able to prioritise effectively

  • Experience in a start-up and/or Proptech desirable but not essential


Perks



  • All employees are invited to participate in our EMI scheme

  • Access to Perks at Work

  • Your birthday off!

  • Pension Scheme

  • Apple Macbook

  • Company socials

  • Company swag

  • Dog-friendly office


Settled is a high-paced, dynamic company. Our employees are all passionate about making a real disruption to the property market for the benefit of our customers, and we're a team of people that like to have fun both in and out of work.


Some of the things to expect from us:



  • Bad jokes

  • Bad taste in music

  • Bad singing

  • But overall...we really help one another, work closely with each other and have fun doing so!

items.content:
Are you a top performer, but you are severely constrained in your current growth path and unable to exercise creativity? Who wants be stuck dialing a zip code? Time to bust loose.
The CompanyLifeguard Solutions is a SaaS-based, Force.com App, that transforms how companies manage their Quality, Health, Safety and Environmental Services. We help our customers to reduce risk, improve compliance and increase productivity.
AppExchange Listing
Due to strong global growth, we're opening the doors for new Account Executives to join our team. Our new-hires will be some of the founding members of this critical team.
This is a rare chance to join a true technology startup, working with a close-knit team to create new business processes, uncover new opportunities and position yourself for success and rapid career progression.
LocationNote: This is a remote position, so your physical location can be anywhere.
We are looking for multiple leaders that can serve one or more of the following markets: AUS/NZ, US/ Canada, and Western Europe
About YouAre you a sales focussed problem solver, with an incredible ability to listen, understand, build rapport and close new customers?Do you want to work in a fast-moving, fast-growing, fast-talking start up and have uncapped earning potential?Do you have what it takes to deliver value over and above expectations on a consistent basis?

Uncapped earningsCareer advancement with global opportunitiesA true work hard /play hard start-up environment where we are building things as we goEquity earn-inThorough product training to equip you with the tools to succeed
No Agencies or Recruiters please

items.title: SC New Business Development - Remote Position
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)
items.content:
Are you an exceptional sales professional, passionate about supply chain analytics software and the benefits it can bring to organizations? Are you excited about bringing in new business with your expert sales skills? Do you long to work in a progressive, people-focused company?
We create decision support software solutions that are recognized by Gartner.
Your profileThis job requires combining strong supply chain consultative expertise with the ambition and skills to successfully engage with prospects and transact. You:have a University degree (preferably in Engineering or Supply Chain);have extensive (10+ years) experience with selling Supply Chain Planning software or a similar product;want to show the benefits that supply chain analytics can have in driving top line performance using market-leading software;love traveling and meeting new people but also have the work ethic to work from home or a remote office;have a strong understanding of the supply chain process;are passionate about engaging with prospective customers to build a relationship and establish trust;
Your major tasks and responsibilitiesYou will:qualify new business opportunities for the U.S. market and attract internal resources to bid and drive to close;build rapport with prospects and understand their supply chain process;align with relevant stakeholders to maximize outcomes;use Salesforce to input and manage all sales deals;perform demos of our solutions

A great place to workAt AIMMS we:have unique advantages in the supply chain analytics market that are recognized by Gartnerare proud of our culture and believe it is special. It is about people, about trust, about valuing differences and about the combination of performance and care. Read in our latest Culture Book to see what AIMMSians write about it.are a self-managed organization practicing Holacracy. We function with autonomy and transparency, and offer opportunities to develop yourself to your full potential.are a strong team of first-class, passionate colleagues with many different nationalities that form part of a small, fast-growing company, serving customers around the world.offer an environment where you can focus on your greatest strengths and identify and pursue your passionsgive you the opportunity to further grow and developoffer an attractive pay and benefits package
About AIMMSAIMMS is a global software company with deep roots in mathematical modeling & optimization and operations research. We develop a platform that takes people and organizations to the next level in decision-making. Our mathematical optimization has been honed and refined for 30 years. The AIMMS Prescriptive Analytics Platform isthe ideal tool for those with an Operations Research or Analytics background. AIMMS SC Navigator, built on the AIMMS Prescriptive Analytics Platform, provides configurable Apps for supply chain teams so they can get thesame benefits from sophisticated analytics without needing an analytics background.
AIMMS has embraced Holacracy, a self-management practice for running purpose-driven, responsive companies, since 2016. Adopting Holacracy as a way of working has allowed us to push the performance and engagement of our team to higher levels. AIMMSians do not believe in hierarchy or corporate egos. We strive for agility and transparency of information. Using a system of self-organization like Holacracy, while being driven by our purpose and values, allows us to unleash our collective intelligence, foster trust and personal development, and serve ourcustomers in the best way.
Our dedicated team works from offices located in Haarlem, The Netherlands, Singapore and Bellevue, Washington and enjoys a culture of open dialogue, trust, talent development and a deep ambition to serve our customers. We also share a strong set of common values and work hard to build and sell our great products. We hire A-players who set stretch goals, adopt high standards for themselves and work collaboratively.
Applicants should be authorized to work in the US or have an H1-B visa.
Interested? Please send your resume and a cover letter detailing why you would be a good fit for the position to
No acquisition please. AIMMS is an equal opportunity employer.
Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. You may reach us at and ask for Megan.

items.title: MonkeyLearn: Sales Executive
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=8, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Sales Executive

MonkeyLearn is an easy-to-use machine learning solution that empowers companies to create new value from their data. 

Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing are cutting-edge technologies that have the potential to disrupt the way we work and boost our daily productivity. At MonkeyLearn we're on a mission to make this technology accessible for everybody. 

We work together with customers from top tech companies in Silicon Valley, Los Angeles, and New York. We are backed by top tier investors including Uncork Capital, Bling Capital and angel investors including Des Traynor, Eoghan McCabe (Intercom), Henry Ward (Carta), Howie Liu (Airtable), Alex Solomon (PagerDuty), and Anthony Goldbloom (Kaggle/Google). 

We are looking for customer focused, sales-orientated individuals with relevant experience selling in the SaaS industry, who are ready for an impact role in building out our sales team. You will need to be a self-starter trailblazer, who can develop and own their pipeline and responsibilities, and who is comfortable wearing many hats. 

As part of a remote team we need people that can live by our values, and that we can trust to perform with limited supervision. You'll be joining a small team and will have an immediate impact on our product and customers.

Job duties and responsibilities 

  • Qualify and close mid market accounts, ~ $12k to 36k ACV deals, with the opportunity to work on deals up to $100k in size.
  • Be the first touch into innovative later stage companies such as Segment, Carta, Snapchat, Box, etc.
  • Manage sales territory, research accounts, map organizations, and understand how to move a relationship forward.
  • Leverage the use of Proof of Concepts to educate prospects and lead compelling presentations to a broad range of audiences from c-level executives to individual contributors
  • Define Statement of Work contracts and and navigate through vendor due diligence and security processes.
  • Work on building a repeatable and scalable sales process, we're looking for a trailblazer.
  • Bring valuable insights and product feedback to our product team in an organized, actionable format to facilitate ongoing client-driven product development.

Required qualifications 

  • You have 3+ years experience closing deals in the SaaS industry
  • You have a proven track record of hitting or exceeding goals
  • You are an exceptional written and spoken communicator
  • You are highly organized & autonomous
  • You are comfortable and energized operating in a fast moving organization
  • You are entrepreneurial and self-motivated
  • You are intellectually curious and ambitious
  • You have experience working with CRM and sales enablement tools

Nice to have 

  • Knowledge and experience in the SaaS industry
  • Interest in learning more about AI, SaaS and data tools
  • Interest in learning programming skills
  • Remote work experience

Tools we use 

  • Sales
    • Salesforce, Hubspot, Outreach, Clearbit
  • Project management
    • Asana, Notion and Google Docs
  • Communication
    • Gmail, Slack and Zoom
  • Productivity
    • Zapier

Working at MonkeyLearn 

  • Join a growing startup in an innovative industry backed by top tier investors in Silicon Valley
  • Work in real world machine learning and natural language processing projects
  • Work with top companies from all over the world, particularly from Silicon Valley, Los Angeles, and New York
  • Friendly and thriving team
  • ⏰ Flexible time
  • Remote team distributed between United States, Europe and South America
See all of our positions here.

items.title: Sendwave: Call Center Representative
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Call Center Representative

Our mission
In 2018, immigrants worldwide sent over $600 billion home to family and friends, dwarfing foreign governmental aid. In the age of cheap, quick transfers through services like Paypal and Venmo, these people are trekking to stores to pay fees averaging over 7% for transfers that typically take 24 hours or more.

Wave's mission is to change that by making sending money anywhere in the world easy and affordable. Since 2014, our app has allowed Africans in the US, the UK, and Canada to send money instantly to mobile money wallets in Kenya, Uganda, Ghana, Tanzania, and Nigeria saving our users over 70% relative to Western Union and MoneyGram.

How you'll help us achieve it
Our Longtime User Happiness (LUH) customer support team is the 'frontline' for ensuring all users can achieve Sendwave's mission. To do so, delighting our users remains a core value for our team. Every decision we make as a company is driven by asking how much something would help our existing and future users. Excellent customer support is essential to making sure we treat our users well, and that’s why we need support team members with the skills to delight our users 100% of the time.

As a member of our Support Team, you'll:
  • Work regular full-time shifts on our support inbox, handling incoming calls, outgoing calls, texts & emails.
  • Identify patterns in user feedback and translate those into suggestions for improving our user experience.
  • Quickly identify major issues affecting a number of users and be an advocate for having them addressed swiftly.
  • Participate in regular trainings & team meetings. 

You might be a good fit if you:
  • Truly enjoy helping to solve problems for our awesome customers.
  • Exhibit excellent written & verbal communication skills.
  • Approach others’ problems with compassion and a desire to keep problem-solving an issue until you understand what is going on.
  • Are motivated to help Sendwave grow through providing stellar service to our customers.

Requirements (must have all to apply)
  • 2+ years experience in a call / contact center or as a dispatcher / receptionist in a large office
  • Ability to commit to a full-time schedule 
  • Ability to work your assigned shift, as we are open 24 hours per day / 7 days per week. We currently have a number of shifts available: 
    • 8am-4pm EST (days off to be discussed)
    • 4pm-12am EST (days off Sunday + Monday)
    • 4pm-12 am EST (days off Tuesday + Wednesday)
  • Ability to work weekends, evenings, and statutory holidays if required
  • Advanced fluency in English (speaking / writing). The job requires the ability to communicate in English with our customers and team at a professional working capacity. 
  • Work authorization in the United States, United Kingdom, Canada, Belgium, Germany, Kenya, and Senegal

Location
Our company, including our support team, is 100% remote, and the role can be carried out from any quiet location with reliable, fast internet. You can be based in the United States, United Kingdom, Canada, Belgium, Germany, Kenya, and Senegal.

Salary and Benefits
  • $18 USD/hour (or equivalent in another currency)
  • Benefits package
  • Equipment provided (laptop, phone, headset, & Skype phone plans)

Our team
  • We are a distributed group of engineers and operations headquarter members and over fifty customer support representatives, spread across three continents who are deeply passionate about our mission.
  • We collectively speak over twenty languages, including Swahili, Dutch, Luganda, Somali, Amharic, Mandarin, Wolof, Fante, Ewe and Arabic.
  • Sendwave is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

How to apply
  • Apply at this link: https://boards.greenhouse.io/waveapp/jobs/4449898002
  • Submit your resume / CV and cover letter using the links provided. In your cover letter, please answer the following questions: 
    • Why are you looking to leave your old role (if applicable)?
    • What are you looking for in a role now?
    • Why Sendwave?
  • Answer required questions below 
  • Applications will be accepted on a rolling basis until we fill all positions

items.title: Sales Development Representative
items.content:
Company Description


Outpost24 is a leading cyber assessment company focused on enabling its customers to achieve maximum value from their evolving technology investments. By leveraging our full stack security insights to reduce attack surface for any architecture, Outpost24 customers continuously improve their security posture with the least effort. Over 2,000 customers in more than 40 countries around the world trust Outpost24 to assess their devices, networks, applications, cloud and container environments and report compliance status for government, industry sector, or internal regulations. Founded in 2001, Outpost24 serves leading organizations across a wide range of segments including financial and insurance, government, healthcare, retail, telecommunications, technology, and manufacturing.


 


Position


Do you love building relationships? Are you passionate about sales? Would you like the opportunity to work in one of the fastest growing industries? Then here’s your chance!


Outpost24 is looking for a dedicated Sales Development Representative. Your main focus will be to generate leads and contact new customer prospects for new business.  You will create and maintain a solid new business pipeline by identifying new business opportunities – including growth areas, trends, customers, products and services.  You will be responsible for a smooth and efficient transition from the new business stage (onboarding phase) to the account management stage (customer success journey).


You will be an important player for the growth of Outpost24 in the Germany, Austria and Switzerland (DACH region); therefore, we see that you are target driven.


Your responsibilities include:



  • Reaching out to potential customer through customized and personal communication (Cold calling / Social Selling)

  • Conduct in-bound and out-bound campaign calling activities to business prospects in assigned territory

  • First point of contact of prospective clients for the DACH region

  • Maintain sales activities and data in Salesforce

  • Identify new business opportunities

  • Negotiate pricing with potential customers

  • Understand the need of your customers and being able to respond effectively with a plan of how to meet our customer’s needs

  • Reviewing your own sales performance, aiming to meet or exceed targets set by the Company.


 


Requirements


The ideal candidate has 1-3 years’ experience working with new business development (B2B experience), preferably experience in the IT-security or IT-industry, holds a bachelor’s degree (preferably within Economics, IT or Engineering). We see that you have a real “hunter” spirit with high ambitions to get things done, you are goal and result driven.  You agree with our sales team values – Deliver results, customer dedication and think big – and can give us examples of how you live by these values. It will be considered an advantage if you are used to working with MS Office and Salesforce.


You are described as entrepreneurial, networker, team player and social. You have excellent communication skills in person, mail and phone.  You want to belong to a team of professionals who enjoys having fun at work and you wish to be a part of fast-growing, cutting edge cyber security company.


We see that you are fluent in German and English as this is the corporate language. The position is home based. As part of the recruitment process you must be able to pass a background check in order to qualify for this position.  Please do not delay in applying as we will close down the position once the right candidate is found.


 


Other information


We welcome you to a challenging, innovative environment with great opportunities for you to grow.



  • We offer you a competitive salary together with a commission opportunity.

  • Elaborative set of tools to drive your career, training and coaching on the job.

  • Healthy work-life balance, which means you can enjoy flexible working hours.

  • International, innovative team where you really matter

  • Possibility to expense gym membership

  • Enrollment in our pension scheme

  • Great development opportunities


Do you feel this role is for you? Please don’t hesitate to send in your application as soon as possible.


This position will remain open for application until the role is filled.


This position will remain open for application until the role is filled. Please do not delay in applying as we will close down the position once the right candidate is found.

By leveraging our full stack security insights to reduce attack surface for any architecture, Outpost24 customers continuously improve their security posture with the least effort. Over 2,000 customers in more than 40 countries around the world trust Outpost24 to assess their devices, networks, applications, cloud and container environments and report compliance status for government, industry sector, or internal regulations. Founded in 2001, Outpost24 serves leading organizations across a wide range of segments including financial and insurance, government, healthcare, retail, telecommunications, technology, and manufacturing.


 


Position


Do you love building relationships? Are you passionate about sales? Would you like the opportunity to work in one of the fastest growing industries? Then here’s your chance!


Outpost24 is looking for a dedicated Key Account Manager for New Business with the drive to meet ambitious targets and increase our market share. You will be responsible for securing success for Outpost24 in their defined regional markets towards medium and large sized enterprises. Together with our Sales Development Representative and the Regional Sales Director, you will be executing growth and account management.


You will be an important player for the growth of Outpost24 in the Germany, Austria and Switzerland (DACH region); therefore, we see that you are target driven.


Your responsibilities include:



  • Create, develop and execute strategies for acquiring new accounts

  • Develop long-term partnerships with targeted accounts that result in increased sales and margins

  • Reaching out to potential customer through customized and personal communication (Cold calling / Social Selling)

  • Maintain sales activities and data in Salesforce

  • Understanding customer's diverse and specific business needs and gathering product knowledge to meet those needs

  • Ensuring high quality of service by developing a thorough and detailed knowledge of technical specifications and other features of employer's systems and processes

  • Identifying opportunities for further sales for development through detailed research of the specific industry or market

  • Preparing and delivering customer presentations and demonstrations of the software, with clarity and confidence

  • Meeting quarterly and yearly targets set by management and contributing to team targets

  • Providing technical advice via our technical staff to customers on all aspects of the installation

  • Providing support to customers, offering clear advice and solutions wherever possible

  • Significant interaction with clients, both face-to-face, online and over the telephone


 


Requirements


The ideal candidate has 3 - 5 years’ experience working with new business development (B2B experience), has recent experience in the IT-industry, holds a bachelor’s degree (preferably within Economics, IT or Engineering). We see that you have a real "hunter" spirit with high ambitions to get things done, you are goal and result driven. You have an excellent track record in the field of cold calling and it's an advantage if you are used to working with MS Office and Salesforce.


You are described as entrepreneurial, networker, team player and social. You have excellent communication skills in person, mail and phone.


We see that you are fluent in German and English as this is the corporate language. The position is home based. As part of the recruitment process you must be able to pass a background check in order to qualify for this position.  Please do not delay in applying as we will close down the position once the right candidate is found.


 


Other information


We welcome you to a challenging, innovative environment with great opportunities for you to grow.



  • We offer you a competitive salary together with a commission opportunity.

  • Elaborative set of tools to drive your career, training and coaching on the job.

  • Healthy work-life balance, which means you can enjoy flexible working hours.

  • International, innovative team where you really matter

  • Possibility to expense gym membership

  • Enrollment in our pension scheme

  • Great development opportunities

items.content:
Admissions Consultant at Independence University

Remote | Entry-level

Online Remote – Continental U.S. Only

Full-time

19-0830

Independence University

Company Overview

The Center for Excellence in Higher Education (CEHE) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit corporation headquartered in Salt Lake City, Utah. CEHE operates degree-granting career colleges throughout the western United States and online. The college brands include Stevens-Henager Colleges in Utah and Idaho; CollegeAmerica in Colorado and Arizona; California College San Diego, and Independence University (online platform). All of the colleges are accredited by ACCSC, a national accrediting body recognized by the U.S. Department of Education. The colleges offer degree programs from the Associate’s level through the Master’s level in a variety of disciplines including Computer Science, Graphic Arts, Business/Accounting, Nursing, and Healthcare. CEHE is an at-will employer.

Admissions Consultant

THIS IS A CONSULTATIVE SALES POSITION

The Admissions Consultant is the first point of contact and first impression prospective students will have of our College. This person needs to have a desire to help make a difference in people’s lives. Admissions Consultants will take incoming calls, and make outbound calls to/from prospective students. The Admissions Consultant plays a vital role in advising and assisting students with the pursuance of their educational goals. It is the Consultants responsibility to accurately assess and educate prospective students on our college, and its requirements. The goal is to recommend students for acceptance and enroll them into their chosen career field. Adherence to company policies and procedures is a must, and is crucial to follow the sales script and presentation at all times.

Essential Functions:

  • Meeting monthly/weekly goals
  • Obtaining monthly referrals
  • Follow-up on all leads and questions using the follow-up process
  • Maintain honesty and professionalism
  • Provide outstanding service and assistance to all prospective students
  • Ensure zero error rate in data gathering and entry
  • Maintain database in an organized, error-free manner
  • Must be able to lift 15 lbs.
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

  • No job hoppers (must not have more than three jobs within the past five years)
  • Positive attitude is a must
  • Professional level of written and oral communication
  • Effective negotiation and motivation techniques
  • Ability to be persuasive and influential
  • Accurately utilize large database
  • Manage time effectively
  • Sales and recruiting experience
  • Able to work evenings and some weekends
  • Convey enthusiasm with sincerity and consistency
  • Strong customer service and communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Degree preferred or 4 years comparable experience in sales.

Working from Home Requirements:

  • Dedicated space/office must be free from distractions and background noise (personal calls, visitors, pets, TV, children, etc.)
  • Must adhere to set schedule
  • Continuous/active communication with managers and co-workers
  • Must have the following resources at home:
    • Dedicated office space that can accommodate dual monitors, computer, and VPN device
    • A hard-wired (from the computer to the internet router/modem) High-speed internet with:
      • A minimum of 6 Mbps download speed and 1.5 upload speed
      • Latency/Ping must be @ 40-45ms or lower
    • Depending on the availability; Cable, DSL, Fiber are only supported ISP provider services (candidates must provide Internet Service Provider Name and the test results before hire)
    • Satellite, Hot Spot and any other unreliable services are not supported by CEHE; Wireless connection is also not supported

Benefits:

  • Business Casual Dress code
  • Paid vacation, time off/sick pay and Holidays
  • Friendly, team environment
  • Educational Benefits

Measures of Merit:

TBD by supervisor within 90 days of hire.

items.content:
*Licensed Inbound Sales Representative - Work From Home - Houston, TX (REQUIRED: must live within 60 miles of Houston, TX)*
We are seeking those that have an active insurance license to join our team as a inbound sales rep working remotely from your home. On our team, you'll be taking inbound calls from customers interested in buying insurance.*NO COLD CALLING!*
*.
We'll provide you with office equipment and training virtually so that you can feel confident you're providing the best possible customer service while still in a work from home environment. As the voice of Progressive to our customers, you'll explain policy coverage and sell insurance products and services. You'll have the support of a virtual, collaborative team, which includes ongoing coaching and development.
*2019 Training Start Dates & Schedule:*
*.Start Date: November 4, 2019 or January 27, 2020*
*.Training Hours:*Monday - Friday, 10:00am - 6:45pm (EST)
*.Work Schedule Options:*Choose from 3 schedule options with start times between 8:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. local time including one weekend day
*Duties & Responsibilities:*
* Build trust by understanding the unique needs of our customers, and offering the best insurance solutions to meet those needs
* Educate customers on our insurance products and services while identifying opportunities to sell additional products
*.
*Qualifications:*
* Must live within 60 miles of Houston, TX
* Active Personal Lines or Property & Casualty (P&C) license
* One or more years of college education or relevant work experience
* Work or educational experience must include:
o Customer service, sales and/or influencing others
o Fast paced and changing environment
o Multitasking and time management skills
o Effectively communicating verbally and in writing
o Computer skills
*Prefer previous remote work experience and/or contact center experience*
*.
*Pay Rate: $16.00 -$19.00 per hour*, plus:
* Additional 10% shift differential pay when you work evenings or weekends
* Top performance awards and contests with cash payouts
*Benefits & Perks:*
Progressive offers the confidence and stability that comes with working for a growing, always evolving organization. Progressive employees also benefit from:
* Annual gainshare bonus of up to 16% of your salary; Progressive rewards each of us with an annual bonus based on company performance
* 401k which includes dollar-for-dollar company match of up to 6%
* Paid training, tuition assistance and career development
* Diverse, welcoming culture with Employee Resource Groups
* Dedication to work/life balance including beginning to earn paid time off after your first two weeks
* Wellness program with discounts & rewards and the standard benefits (medical, dental, vision)
*Work From Home Office Details:*
* Designated workspace that is free from noise and other distractions and allows for dedicated focus
* Remote office Internet connection should be via DSL or Cable Modem with minimum speed of 1mbps down and 0.5mbps up.
* Your computer or Router should be physically connected to the modem by a cable. No wireless connection
* All Progressive hardware you receive needs to be connected to a surge protector
*Apply Today!*
Equal Opportunity Employer
