*Location:*.Texas-Houston*

items.title: Migration Advisor
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=12, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Migration Advisor at Empire Flippers

Remote | International

We’re hiring!

We are looking to bring on a Migration Advisor to join our operations team. The role is 100% location independent, allowing you to live anywhere in the world!

This is a huge opportunity for you to work with one of the fastest-growing companies in the U.S. and learn the ins and outs of the online business world. Over the last couple of years, our company has seen explosive growth—and there is no sign of it slowing down.

In order to keep hitting our goals, including our 2019 goal of $42 million worth of businesses sold, we need to expand our horizons and improve our customer experience to a point that makes us the de-facto standard for buying and selling online businesses. Your work will help propel the industry forward to new levels not seen before.

So what is a Migration Advisor?

A Migration Advisor takes a hands-on role, transferring businesses from sellers to buyers in a safe and efficient manner. This can be a stressful time for both parties as they near completion of a potentially life-changing deal. It will be your mission to oversee the asset transfer, keep things moving forward and ensure that everyone is in the loop regarding the migration status.

You will spend the first couple of months training with our Migration Supervisor, George Sanderson. The first six months will act as your probationary period, at the end of which (all going well) we’ll have you up and running as a fully-fledged Migration Advisor

What’s the Opportunity?

Becoming a Migration Advisor makes you a critical part of Empire Flippers. You will learn skills that will last you a lifetime in the online business world. We will teach you all of our methods for transferring online businesses and you’ll be deep-diving into the backend of all of the businesses we sell.

You will represent our brand and be the face of Empire Flippers to buyers and sellers at an integral part of the buying and selling process.

Once a buyer and seller agree on a deal, they’ll be transferred to you to close things out. You’ll be the last piece of the puzzle, helping buyers take over their new business and sellers get paid out.

After all, when a business is sold, a seller can receive a truly life-changing sum of cash for their business. In some cases, we’ve even paid out a million+ dollars to a seller.

What’s the Position Like?

The Migration Advisor role is vital to the success of our company.

Since this role will have you speaking to buyers and sellers around the world, it can be a bit stressful here and there. You will need to work weird hours sometimes to make sure you can get on the phone with sellers in different time zones. You will also need to be extremely detail-oriented to make sure that processes are followed to a tee.

Not all buyers and sellers are familiar with the technical aspects of migrating a business; you will need to guide them through the process in a clear and logical manner, ensuring all parties know what’s going on.

Of course, as in any role, sometimes things may not go quite to plan. It’s at this point that your role becomes most critical; you’ll need to calmly troubleshoot issues and make buyers and sellers feel that we have things in hand.

You will drive all of our migrations through a multi-step migration process. We are constantly refining this process to make the transfer as seamless as possible and ensure that we are in-line with any updates to program terms and conditions. As you become more seasoned, you will be tasked with improving this migration process.

We will train you on how to use the various tools we use to migrate businesses. You’ll also be digging into the backend of websites and learning about the various technical aspects of moving a site.

While you don’t have to be a “techie,” having the capacity to learn the technical nuances of the process is a must.

You’ll also be exposed to contracts and purchase agreements for multi-million dollar deals. It will be your job to ensure that the migration is conducted in line with the contract.

Finally, on the rare occasion that some form of renegotiation is required during the migration, you’ll run point on that, helping buyers and sellers to reach a point that works for all parties.

What Skills Do I Need?

We believe in hiring people that are a good fit for us culturally. A good fit is actually more important to us than the skill sets since we will teach you everything you need to know.

While no previous work experience is required, having a background in customer service and/or some kind of technical chops is helpful. Plus, there are some qualities that will go a long way in helping you succeed in this position, such as:

  • You need to be detail-oriented. Migration is a meticulous job. You will be closely following our tried and tested processes and it’s vital that steps are followed closely and accurately.
  • You need to be a team player. The migration team regularly interact with other areas of the business. You’ll be working closely with our sales team to ensure a smooth customer transition when a deal is done. You’ll give feedback to our vetting department on processes tweaks they can make to make your life easier. You need to be good at communicating your thoughts and getting buy-in from colleagues.
  • You’re good at defusing problems. Buying and selling a business is an intimate process. There will almost always be obstacles and challenges for you to help both parties overcome. You’ll need to approach problems in a fair and constructive manner, keeping buyers and sellers calm and giving them confidence that you’ve got their back.
  • You’re not afraid of getting on the phone. The migration position will require you to get on the phone a lot with buyers and sellers. Your phone communication needs to be spot-on and you have to be comfortable making those calls to get all the information we need from the buyer and seller.

What’s the Lifestyle Like?

Our company is built on a culture of remote work, travel, and living life on your terms. Being a location-independent full-time position is one of the many benefits!

We aren’t going to chain you to a cubicle. You’ll be free to work anywhere in the world that serves your creativity best. The choice is yours. While we’re an Inc. 5000 company, we’re not a Fortune 500 company. You won’t be some badge number in the corporate machine. We will want your input and insight. As you gain more experience, we are going to rely on you to make our process better and smoother for our sellers while also helping to increase the number of high-quality businesses that go live on our marketplace.

When you first start off, you will be working and training with our Migration Supervisor, George Sanderson. Once we get into 2020, we may ask you to attend a couple of weeks of in-person training at a location to be determined. Of course we will cover the cost of any travel that we require you to do during your probationary period.

You won’t start off making much money.

For the first six months, you will be paid $2,000 USD per month during the probation period. In addition to this, you’ll get a housing stipend of $700 USD per month for months 1 through 6. While not a lot, it is enough to have an enjoyable time in many countries around the world and (just to remind you) you’ll be completely location independent! After six months, you will be gradually introduced to our compensation plan. Within 12 months, you can expect to earn $40,000-$46,000 USD per year, and have paid, international healthcare coverage.

This amount is more than enough to live a very nice lifestyle in Asia or almost anywhere in the world (within reason).

Love It. What’s the Catch?

While our lifestyle is pretty great, this isn’t a gap year experience to go travel the world.

We are looking for career-minded people that can make a positive impact on our business. Sure, sometimes we really do work by the pool, but we also work hard.

There will be days when you clock in 12 hours. There will also be days when you are up at all sorts of strange hours dealing with our sellers who live anywhere from the U.S. and U.K. to Eastern Europe and Asia.

While you might take a long break during the middle of the day, you might also find yourself burning the midnight oil as you hop onto a call to get a buyer or seller through the last hump of the migration process.

A lot of people love the idea of finding a job that allows them to travel the world and get a different job later back home. That is not this job.

We want you for the long-haul. We want you to grow with us and turn this position into a prosperous career.

Details to Keep in Mind

  • Remember, we’re not going to throw you into the fire from day one.
  • When you first come on board, you’re going to learn about our company. We will do a deep dive into how our processes and systems work, set you up in the backend, and teach you about each department within the business.
  • We’ll start you off with low-level tasks. As you get better acquainted with our business, we will gradually build up your workload, get you comfortable with routine migrations, and then start having you take on more ambitious projects.
  • We will review every application that comes our way. If we believe you’re a good fit for us, we will reach out to set up an interview. Typically, there are two rounds of interviews before we make a decision.
  • If you believe you’re a good fit, you have until October 13, 2019 to apply.
  • A background check is required before employment.

How Do I Apply?

Here is the sequence of events we use when hiring our new Migration Advisor:

  • You record a YouTube video* explaining who you are and why you’re a good fit for the position, fill out an application by clicking the link below, and submit it ASAP by October 13, 2019.
  • We review submissions and schedule first interviews.
  • Once second interviews are done, a final decision is made.
  • The chosen candidate will be announced by the end of October.
  • The chosen candidate will start with the company on December 2nd, 2019.

YouTube Video Requirements:

We will only accept submissions that include a YouTube URL. Please leave the video “unlisted” in preferences and share the link with us. The quality of the video doesn’t matter, and there are no bonus points for editing. We just want (up to) three minutes of you explaining and answering the following questions (based on your previous experience):

  1. Describe how your past experiences and current skill set will allow you to succeed working as a Migration Advisor.
  2. Tell us one thing about you that sets you apart from the other candidates applying for this role.

If you’re thinking about applying but are worried you might not have enough (insert excuse here) — don’t worry. If you want to build something more than just a 9-to-5 job, then click the button below.

Apply for job

items.title: National Manager, Outside Sales
items.content:
National Manager, Outside Sales at AURIC

Remote

Alarm/Merc Services Experience Pref (Base + Residual Income)

  • New York, NY – Remote OK
  • Full-Time

Job Description

Do you want to be part of a young start-up disrupting the electronic payments industry?

We are seeking professionals with outside sales team management and/or team-building experience.

The Ideal Candidate:

  • Knows that “cash is dead” and wants to benefit from the upside in electronic payments
  • Has extensive experience in building and driving outside sales teams
  • Passionate about the AURIC mission of specializing in a flat dollar pricing model

If this is you, then we want to hear from you!

AURIC is rapidly growing the B2B Acquisitions channel and we are seeking Regional Sales Managers that are entrepreneurial-minded and possess a start-up attitude. Remote positions are available.

Primary responsibilities will be to achieve all points of our R.E.A.D.I. management model:

  • Recruit – Attract coachable sales professionals that have high emotional intelligence
  • Enforce – We are a process-driven sales environment backed built measurable metrics
  • Acquire – Dominate your territory/niche vertical through referrals and prospecting both SMB and mid-market clients
  • Develop – Recognize that your team is a reflection of you and utilize the AURIC training library to develop the next superstar
  • Inspire – Your team will embrace and align with AURIC’s core purpose of delivering, Payment technology so business can thrive

Compensation:

2018 average first-year sales manager earnings:

  • $120k to $160k in upfront commissions
  • $7,500 additional monthly residual income

Lifetime vesting and escalated residuals are retroactively applied based on client count.

There are no earnings caps.

This is a short sales cycle that is incentive-driven. Longer sales pipelines only account for 20% of our revenue.

Please do not apply without prior outside sales management experience.

Sales Managers will be required to recruit and develop a team of 5-10 Sales Agents stationed in the field locally or nationally.

Your future Sales Agents will receive industry best:

  • Training Upon Launch
  • Base Pay + Commissions w/No Caps
  • Detailed Roadmap for Success
  • CRM Marketing Support
  • Continuing Training and Education

Minimum Requirements:

  • Laptop, Smart Phone, Tablet Proficiency
  • CRM Fanatic
  • 3 Years Equivalent Sales Experience
  • Outside Sales Experience in B2B or B2C Setting
  • Confident Phone Demeanor
  • Demonstrated Record of Success Leading Teams
  • Ability to Communicate Clearly in Writing
  • Find-A-Way-To-Win Mentality

Candidates with the following backgrounds are encouraged to apply:

  • Small-Business Ownership
  • Commercial / Residential Alarm Sales
  • Advertising Sales
  • Timeshare / Real Estate Sales
  • Financial Planning
  • Automotive Finance

AURIC is a New York-based electronic payment technology company that operates on the TSYS network – the industry’s most advanced payment processing platform (NYSE: TSS). We are innovators of the flat dollar pricing experience. By eliminating the unpredictable interest rates associated with accepting electronic payments our clients are able to thrive.

Apply for job

items.title: Marketing Sales Executive
items.content:
Marketing Sales Executive at Firegang

Remote | High-paying

Location Seattle, Washington

Department Sales

Employment Type Full Time

Minimum Experience Executive

Compensation $70-$125K

Location Independent, W2 Salary + Commission & Full Benefits

Who We Are

Firegang Dental Marketing is a digital marketing company headquartered in Spokane, Washington that has been in business for over 10 years. Our clients are primarily Dentists and our service packages include website design, paid ad management, SEO, analytics, copywriting and more.

Our mission is to partner with dental practices by providing marketing solutions and consultative services that drive success.

Our company is made up of smart, fun, hard-working marketing professionals working remotely throughout the US. Our core values are:

  • Innovation: Have a compelling desire to win and improve the marketplace. Continually learning, testing and growing to be the best marketing solution in the dental marketplace.
  • Delivery: Exceed client expectations by providing an excellent client experience to retain clients that are happy and value partnership
  • Ownership: Exhibit personal accountability to meet the business needs, improve our systems and services, and help others improve their effectiveness
  • Attitude: Approach all situations with respect and professionalism, an open mind and a confidence in each others capabilities and intentions.
  • Development: Creating an environment for personal and professional growth, building the organization from within.
  • Mindset: Recognize that change and profitability are essential to our future success.

Job Summary

This is a unique opportunity for the type of person that loves sales, work freedom and flexibility, and helping DRIVE growth. This person will be responsible for the entire sales process, including presentations, tracking and follow-up.

We are looking for someone with a proven track record in selling high-value services to business owners who also has experience in Digital Marketing. Experience in the dental/medical field is not necessary but is a bonus.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Conducting calls via phone and video chat to assess dentist’s needs to be able to present a viable marketing solution
  • Keeping detailed notes and records of all your daily tasks and interactions in our CRM system
  • Responsible for client acquisition
  • Working with marketing on acquisition and follow-up for qualified leads
  • Working with the Client Success Managers for a smooth client handoff to onboarding
  • Other Basic Job Details including but not limited to document preparation, invoice processing and system analysis.
  • Work roughly 9-5 on weekdays with some flexibility
  • Ability to answer “after hours” calls or chats

Key Requirements

  • Online Sales experience
  • Ability to present to clients on video
  • Strong phone skills – you will be on the phone a lot!
  • Ability to explain complicated strategies in a way non-tech savvy audiences can understand
  • Experience in Google Docs/Spreadsheets
  • Excellent follow-through skills
  • Independent research
  • Very high attention to detail

Demonstrated Skills in Core Areas:

  • Independent thinker who takes initiative and provides a unique approach to challenges.
  • Self-starter that works well independently and with a team
  • Enjoys a fast paced, progressive work environment
  • Adaptable to change
  • Basic knowledge of SEO/SEM, paid ad management, funnels, social media and display advertising campaigns

Bonus Points For:

  • Experience with B2B sales (especially small businesses)
  • Experience with selling in the dental industry
  • Knowledge of dental profession/industry
  • Sales writing experience

Our Employee Compensation Package Includes:

  • Base salary plus commission with no cap
  • PPO Health Benefits (medical/dental)
  • 401K Option with matching
  • Generous PTO and Holiday Schedule
  • 100% Telecommute
  • Life, AD&D, Short, and Long Term Disability Insurances
Apply for job

items.title: Praktikant / Werkstudent Business Development (m/w/x) // MVP Factory
items.content:
Praktikant / Werkstudent Business Development (m/w/x) // mvpfactory

Company: mvpfactory

Tags:
  • Business Development
  • Working Student

    • MVP Factory treibt die Digitalisierung in Europa mit Hilfe von smarten Services, AI-unterstützten Technologien und herausragenden Talenten voran. Auf Basis unserer drei Standbeine glauben wir, die innovativste und umfassendste Lösung für die “Future of Work” bauen zu können:

    1. MVPF als kreative Digitalagentur, die Softwareprodukte end-to-end von der Ideation bis zum Launch aufbaut und dabei hilft, bestehende Produktentwicklungsprozesse zu optimieren.
    2. MVPF Match, das EU-weite Netzwerk der besten 5% von Senior-Tech-Experten, welche bei Bedarf einzeln oder als Teams remote oder vor Ort gebucht werden können und bestehende Teams unterstützen.
    3. MVPF als Venture Builder, welcher in ausgewählten Projekten gezielt über die reine Produktentwicklung hinaus geht und in Kooperation mit führenden Unternehmen neue Tech-Startups erschafft. Diese bauen auf zuvor validierten Ideen auf und entwickeln und vermarkten digitale B2B- oder B2C-Produkte, die gesellschaftlichen Mehrwert zu schaffen.

    Gegründet von Philipp Petrescu (ex. VP Finance Rocket Internet, Gründer von Lendico – Verkauf an ING Bank, Forbes 30u30) vereinen wir im Team unternehmerische Erfahrung mit starkem Produkt, Design und Tech Verständnis. Für Kunden wie Merck, Daimler, Roland Berger, VISA oder N26 haben wir in den letzten Jahren über 150 Projekte vollendet, immer mit starkem Fokus auf Tech-Execution.

    Werde Teil des “MVPF Future Founder” Programms: Du hast Lust, dich zu beweisen und in der Berliner Startup Szene aktiv zu werden? Unser Programm ist dafür da, deine persönliche Entwicklung zu unterstützen und dich vor neue Herausforderungen zu stellen. Unsere Praktikanten und Werkstudenten bekommen vom ersten Tag an die Gelegenheit die digitalen Branchen der Zukunft von verschiedenen Blickwinkeln kennen zu lernen und so einen Karrierefortschritt zu erzielen. Vom Day-to-Day Business bis hin zu strategischen Projekten ist alles dabei. Bei uns kannst du neue Ideen mitentwickeln und umsetzen und mit unseren Kunden gemeinsam neue Ziele erreichen.

    Aktuell suchen wir vor allem nach Unterstützung im Business Development, sind aber auch immer an spannenden Profilen für Marketing & Communication, Operations, und Product interessiert.

    Im Business Development erwartet dich ein tiefer Einblick in ein innovatives und profitables Digital-Startup:

    • Übernimm Verantwortung für Projekte, die MVP Factory als den führenden “Future of Work”-Anbieter etablieren
    • Entwickle neue Ideen, Strukturen und Produkte für uns und unsere Kunden
    • Identifiziere und akquiriere neue Wachstumspotenziale und Kunden
    • Deine Arbeit ist die Grundlage für wichtige, strategische Entscheidungen

    Das bringst Du mit:

    • Du hast das vierte Semester Deines Bachelor Studiums in Business, Finance, Engineering, Mathematik oder verwandten Fächern abgeschlossen oder arbeitest aktuell an Deinem Master / MBA
    • Du kannst starke akademische Leistungen vorweisen und hast bereits relevante Arbeitserfahrung sammeln können, zum Beispiel in der Beratung, Investment Banking, Startups oder DAX 30
    • Du hast herausragende analytische Skills, ein Auge fürs Detail und eine “Hands-on” Mentalität, mit der Du gerne Verantwortung übernimmst und sowohl selbstständig als auch im Team gerne arbeitest
    • Du kannst Dich schriftlich und verbal gut artikulieren und scheust Dich nicht vor direktem Kontakt mit unseren Kunden
    • Du bist im Herzen Entrepreneur, mit Interesse an der Startup-Industrie und dem Willen, Dich weiter zu entwickeln und der Berliner Startup Szene zu zeigen, was Du kannst!
    • Du arbeitest flexibel, schnell und zuverlässig, selbst wenn es mal anspruchsvoller wird
    • Du kannst uns vor Ort in Berlin unterstützen und sprichst fließend Deutsch und Englisch

    Das bieten wir Dir:

    • Unsere Praktika sind immer fair bezahlt.
    • Spannendes Arbeitsumfeld: Du wirst erstaunt sein, was Du in der Zeit bei uns alles erreicht hast und wie Du mit uns spannende Startups aufbauen konntest!
    • Persönliche Entwicklung: Bei MVPF wirst Du Deine Eigenständigkeit, Kreativität und Leadership-Skills ausbauen, basierend auf Deinen persönlichen Stärken und Interessen.
    • Enge Beziehungen: Unser Team ist ambitioniert und arbeitet hart, weiß aber auch wie man Spaß hat. Freitags Frühstücken wir gemeinsam und freuen uns abends bei Office-Drinks darüber, was wir alles zusammen erreicht haben.
    • Netzwerk: Wir bieten dir die einmalige Chance sowohl erfolgreiche Tech-Entrepreneure als auch spannende Firmen aus unserem Kundennetzwerk kennen zu lernen und lebenslange Beziehungen aufzubauen.
    • Office: Das wohl schönste, hellste und höchste Startup-Office in Berlin im 29. Stock direkt bei den Szene-Bezirken Friedrichshain, Neukölln und Kreuzberg.
    • Food & Snacks: Bei uns bist du immer mit Obst, Snacks und leckeren Getränken (von Mate bis Kaffee) versorgt.
    • Regelmäßige Team Events: Wir feiern unsere Erfolge als Team!
    • Karriere: Wir wachsen schnell und erfolgreiche Praktikanten / Werkstudenten bekommen bei uns ein attraktives Angebot für den Festeinstieg
    Apply for this position

items.title: Account Executive
items.content:
Account Executive at Attribution

Remote | High-paying

$90k $150k No equity

Attribution delivers the most complete performance visibility with unmatched usability and 100% data fidelity to help companies continuously optimize their marketing mix in their buyer’s journey.

You will play a fundamental role in aggressively growing our position in the market. This is a great opportunity to sell the best-in-class product. Great OTE opportunity and 100% remote.

  • Experience closing 6+ figure ARR deals

  • The ability to thrive in a fast paced, results oriented environment

Remote United States

Visa sponsorship Not available

Experience 2+ years

Skills Sales

items.title: National Sales Manager - Remote Position based in Chicago, IL
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
National Sales Manager - Satellite Role based in Chicago, IL.

Selling a memorable experience in an authentic location is the essence of a Sales Managers role at Fairmont Hotels & Resorts. Your professionalism and knowledge of the Hotel will reflect positively in how you present the property. Building strong relationships will create a bond, ensuring your clients will always stay with Fairmont Hotels & Resorts.

Hotel Overview: Picture a shimmering oasis overlooking the Sonoran Desert and the McDowell mountains - Fairmont Scottsdale Princess offers luxury and world class hospitality with over 200,000 square feet of meeting space. This award-winning meetings resort has 750 guest rooms, five award-winning restaurants, six sparkling heated pools, and a luxurious Well & Being Spa. The Fairmont Scottsdale Princess was recently recognized with the AAA Five Diamond rating for its 28th year, making it one of the longest running AAA Five Diamond Resorts in the America's. The only thing missing is you!

Summary of Responsibilities:

Reporting to the Director of Sales, responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following:
  • Minimum of 2-5 years Hotel Sales Experience with successful record of corporate group sales for a large, upscale or luxury hotel in Chicago (or selling a Midwest Market Satellite for a hotel or resort outside of the market) preferred
  • Consistently offer professional, friendly and engaging service.
  • Ensure prompt and courteous service is extended to both internal and external customers.
  • Ensure the achievement of sales objectives on a monthly, quarterly and yearly basis.
  • Solicit group business through action plan preparation and execution.
  • Maintain accounts, contact, activity and business details within the appropriate software applications.
  • Work closely with Catering and Front Office to ensure all details of the contract were delivered.
  • Prepare weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual reports, as required.
  • Balance operational, administrative and Colleague needs.
  • Follow departmental policies and procedures.
  • Follow all safety policies.
  • Establish parameters, quotes and negotiate prices, confirming by written contracts.
  • Participate in tradeshows, conventions and promotional events within the hotel and trade related organizations.
  • Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
  • Minimum of 2-5 years Hotel Sales Experience with successful track records in either hotel or resort sales
  • Must be based in Chicago area
  • Required to travel periodically throughout year
  • Computer literate in Microsoft Window applications and/or relevant computer applications required
  • University/College degree in a related discipline preferred
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal required
  • Strong interpersonal and problem solving abilities
  • Highly responsible & reliable
  • Ability to focus attention on guest needs, remaining calm and courteous at all times
  • Adhere to Fairmont Scottsdale Princess Grooming Guidelines. Click here to view:
Visa Requirements: Proof of eligibility to work in the United States is required.

APPLY TODAY: Whether you're launching your career or seeking meaningful employment, we invite you to visit to learn more about Fairmont Hotels & Resorts-and the extraordinary opportunities that exist!

ABOUT FAIRMONT HOTELS & RESORTS

At Fairmont Hotels & Resorts we offer our guests the finest hospitality experience in each of our destinations. And we know that, to offer our guests the best, we first need to offer our employees the best. That's why you'll find exceptional work opportunities-throughout North America and the Caribbean, Europe and Africa, the Middle East and Asia Pacific-as well as industry-leading training, career development, recognition and rewards. Fairmont Hotels & Resorts is a celebrated collection of hotels that includes landmark locations like London's The Savoy, New York's The Plaza, and Shanghai's Fairmont Peace Hotel. Our teams are guided by values of Respect, Integrity, Teamwork and Empowerment; we employ the highest ethical and quality standards, treating all colleagues with fairness and dignity. Our Sustainability Partnership program represents our ever-expanding commitment to being a responsible business and to following the principles of sustainability across our operations, the world over. An exciting future awaits!

Fairmont Scottsdale Princess is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Drug Free Workplace. F/M/D/V

items.title: Systems Consultant (Sales Engineer), Global Accounts, Remote
items.content:
Senior Presales Systems Engineer

Competitive salary

Dell provides the technology that transforms the way we all work and live. But we are more than a technology company - we are a people company. We inspire, challenge and respect every one of our over 100,000 employees. We also provide them with unparalleled growth and development opportunities.

Our field sales professionals rely on proactive technical support during the sales process - and our expert Systems Engineering team always steps up to the mark. We lead the development and implementation of complex and specialized products, applications, services and solutions. From delivering sales presentations and product demonstrations, to developing detailed installations or system integration plans, we ensure customers get the innovative, relevant, interoperable solutions they need.
Key Responsibilities
  • At this level, supports highly complex and high value accounts exercising wide latitude to determine objectives and approaches
  • Gains access and manages relationships with senior level executives and IT decision makers Devises new approaches/methods to selling enterprise/client products and services
  • Verifies operability of highly complex product and service configuration within the customer's environment that addresses critical issues Identifies and allocates roles and responsibilities required to support account team
  • Synthesizes market, industry and competitor data to anticipate how external factors will influence the position of the solution and makes decisions that impact the long term success of the business
  • Creates formal networks internally and externally with industry experts and key decision makers
  • Leverages third-party and/or the Channel to create and position the solution
  • Assumes leadership role in analyzing requirements and performing advanced systems integration and providing technical expertise to design and implement solution across breadth of Dell and third-party products and services
  • Senior level sales engineer with expert understanding of complex products and services portfolio
  • Leveraged as coach/mentor to others
  • Provides customer/industry/market insight to internal leaders and cross-functional groups
  • Qualifies the most complex sales opportunities in the terms of customer technical requirements, competition, decision making process and funding
  • Presents the design and value of proposed solution and business case to customers, prospects and management at the executive level


Essential Requirements:
  • Typically requires 12+ years of related experience with a Bachelor's degree
  • Assists in formulating the customer's long- term strategic vision and our role as a strategic partner Influences the future development of enterprise/client technology, products, and services
  • Expected to be part of the overall product development cycle Works with strategic planning teams to define future directions and strategies for products and services


Benefits
We offer highly competitive salaries, bonus programs, world-class benefits, and unparalleled growth and development opportunities - all to create a compelling and rewarding work environment.

If you have the technical skills to take our sales to the next level, this is your opportunity to develop with Dell.

Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Learn more about Diversity and Inclusion at Dell here .
- provided by Dice

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
*Licensed Inbound Sales Representative - Work From Home - Houston, TX (REQUIRED: must live within 60 miles of Houston, TX)*
We are seeking those that have an active insurance license to join our team as a inbound sales rep working remotely from your home. On our team, you'll be taking inbound calls from customers interested in buying insurance.*NO COLD CALLING!*
*.
We'll provide you with office equipment and training virtually so that you can feel confident you're providing the best possible customer service while still in a work from home environment. As the voice of Progressive to our customers, you'll explain policy coverage and sell insurance products and services. You'll have the support of a virtual, collaborative team, which includes ongoing coaching and development.
*2019 Training Start Dates & Schedule:*
*.Start Date: November 4, 2019 or January 27, 2020*
*.Training Hours:*Monday - Friday, 10:00am - 6:45pm (EST)
*.Work Schedule Options:*Choose from 3 schedule options with start times between 8:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. local time including one weekend day
*Duties & Responsibilities:*
* Build trust by understanding the unique needs of our customers, and offering the best insurance solutions to meet those needs
* Educate customers on our insurance products and services while identifying opportunities to sell additional products
*.
*Qualifications:*
* Must live within 60 miles of Houston, TX
* Active Personal Lines or Property & Casualty (P&C) license
* One or more years of college education or relevant work experience
* Work or educational experience must include:
o Customer service, sales and/or influencing others
o Fast paced and changing environment
o Multitasking and time management skills
o Effectively communicating verbally and in writing
o Computer skills
*Prefer previous remote work experience and/or contact center experience*
*.
*Pay Rate: $16.00 -$19.00 per hour*, plus:
* Additional 10% shift differential pay when you work evenings or weekends
* Top performance awards and contests with cash payouts
*Benefits & Perks:*
Progressive offers the confidence and stability that comes with working for a growing, always evolving organization. Progressive employees also benefit from:
* Annual gainshare bonus of up to 16% of your salary; Progressive rewards each of us with an annual bonus based on company performance
* 401k which includes dollar-for-dollar company match of up to 6%
* Paid training, tuition assistance and career development
* Diverse, welcoming culture with Employee Resource Groups
* Dedication to work/life balance including beginning to earn paid time off after your first two weeks
* Wellness program with discounts & rewards and the standard benefits (medical, dental, vision)
*Work From Home Office Details:*
* Designated workspace that is free from noise and other distractions and allows for dedicated focus
* Remote office Internet connection should be via DSL or Cable Modem with minimum speed of 1mbps down and 0.5mbps up.
* Your computer or Router should be physically connected to the modem by a cable. No wireless connection
* All Progressive hardware you receive needs to be connected to a surge protector
*Apply Today!*
Equal Opportunity Employer

items.title: iZooto: Sales Development Representative (SDR)
items.content:
Sales Development Representative (SDR)

 We are looking for an entrepreneurial, ambitious Sales Development Representative for the North American market. This is a full-time, 100% remote position. This position comes with a very good base salary plus generous commissions and medical insurance.
 
●      Generate revenue by working through pre-qualified leads 
●      Present & demonstrate our solutions to customers via phone/web meetings. 
●      Work cross-functionally with marketing in order to drive revenue for the company 
●      Build your sales pipeline of all opportunities through Leads and Campaigns and update on a weekly basis. Own and drive at least 3X pipeline targets on a monthly basis. 
●      Strategic probing to identify, evaluate, and recommend alternative business solutions. 
●      Maintain up-to-date knowledge of the company’s competitive positioning in the marketplace. 
●      Managing pipelines and moving opportunities along the sales cycle to closure. 
●      Follow-up on Marketing-generated leads in order to qualify them in an efficient manner, and ensure high translation of lead to revenue. 
●      Periodic Reporting to the Manager. Be Accountable for the accuracy of reporting.

items.title: Customer Relationship Manager (Software / Digital Transformation)
items.content:
About Steer73 


Steer73 are a Digital Transformation Agency. We work with a wide variety of clients to understand their needs, shape their product and to deliver their development work. In many cases we are the client’s in-house product, design and development team.  


Our HQ is in London, UK. We have teams in Ukraine and India, plus people working in various other locations around the world. We are a modern business that benefits from a remote and distributed global team. 


The role 


We are looking for a Customer Relationship Manager (CRM) who will be comfortable in a cross-functional sales, marketing, and account management role that supports all parts of the commercial business. You will report into the Operations Director and will be expected to support both the Product and Managing Director with their account relationships.  


You will be expected to provide operational and scheduling support to our Senior Management team, as well as be able to proactively manage a wide range of tasks at short notice. Your key area of focus will be on lead generation and sales, ensuring that we have a strong pipeline of future business. 


Steer73 are growing quickly with staff numbers doubling in the last 24 months and an ambition to scale the company to over 100 employees in the coming few years. With this growth the business will require a strong CRM to support the Senior Management team. 


You will be eager to learn and develop, have some previous experience in a customer facing role and be passionate about driving change and innovation through a culture of continuous improvement. 


Key tasks 


On a typical day you will be working on various administrative, sales, marketing and customer related related tasks: 



  • Email marketing management: responding to email marketing leads 

  • Lead management: following up on leads and managing the sales lead pipeline 

  • Content management: managing copywriting content for the company website 

  • Engagement: bolstering client engagement across our accounts 

  • Account management: maintaining the account management board and ensuring the tasks are completed  

  • Client review: following up with our customers after each piece of work is completed, e.g. after a project is completed / a sprint ends  

  • Issue resolution: dealing with any client concerns proactively 

  • Service reviews: identifying what services clients are on and opportunities for up sell 

  • Documentation: ensuring sign off documentation is done and delivered 

  • Communication: ensuring clients understand commercial deliverables 

  • Meeting arrangement: arranging client relationship / sales calls for the Managing Director and Product Director 


Required skills 


Core skills – you will be 



  • Pro-active and hardworking: you’re happy to run with tasks given to you and you’re able to prioritise accordingly. 

  • A strong communicator: you have excellent written and spoken English. 

  • Analytical and detail-oriented: you have a high attention to detail and a methodical work approach. 

  • Approachable and consultative: you believe that pride and ego must take a back seat to quality. You value influence over authority. You’re open to input and discussion from all members of the team. 


Company culture  


Steer73 is a small company and an important factor in our hiring is finding people who share our values and who will thrive in our business. 


We have a flat management structure and we look for people who want to get things done, are comfortable making decisions, take ownership of their roles, and want to progress. 


Joining Steer73 offers you the opportunity to work on high-profile and meaningful projects for a wide range of clients and industries, as part of a company with cross sectoral expertise.

items.title: Business Development Executive
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Join the Growth Story at Envitia


We’re a software and services company on a growth trajectory with 25+ years of experience in delivering world-class location and data software and expertise to customers in the public and private sector.


Following a re-organisation last year, the company had a hugely successful 2018 – all down to an amazing group of people.  We’re now looking to grow and build a team that are hungry for success. We’re creating a culture that is fun, supportive yet challenging, and we’re looking for talented like-minded people to join us on this journey.  We’re also looking for people who are comfortable in challenging the norm so we can get truly diverse thinking when solving problems and not just senior management making decisions – we really believe in empowerment.


What do we do? In short, we solve complex data problems to help our customers make better and faster decisions. We do this through our team of data consultants who undertake cutting edge R&D projects or work with customers to find the best data modelling approach, architecture and standards so they’re able to make use of their data.  Or, through our software products where we enable customers to search for, and then visualise, data so they have great situational awareness and can make better decisions.


 


About the Role


Here at Envitia we’re on a success curve and we’re growing our teams across the business to reflect the exceptional reputation we have as creative, nimble solution-focused consultants.  This role is the very epitome of that reputation.  It’s a Hunter approach, through a consultative lens. Consistently demonstrating your ability to build insightful relationships with customers, understand key problems and respond as a Trusted Advisor.  You’ll be able to clearly identify and communicate the point of difference and value that Envitia brings to each unique project.


 


Key tasks include:



  • Build and pursue a pipeline of market opportunities in-line with the sales strategy

  • Work closely with our Business Development Managers to develop new customer relationships in order to deliver profitable new business growth through understanding their needs and requirements

  • Accurately forecast sales to agreed timescales against yearly and quarterly targets

  • Lead the full sales cycle from lead generation to proposal submission, negotiation and contract award

  • Effectively develop and manage proposals, bids and quotations to secure business

  • Identify marketing & PR opportunities linked to relevant markets, customers & opportunities

  • Liaise closely with Consultants and Engineering team for opportunities

  • Maintain accurate account plans & strategies

  • Maintain accurate weekly CRM updates & customer meeting notes

  • Engage in company-wide initiatives: be an Envitia Ambassador.


 


This is a role that will offer you ample opportunity to develop both your business development and technological understanding of complex data solutions.  You will be working with senior experts in their field and your potential career progression could be anywhere from managing a Business Development hub to Sales Director.


 


About You


You’re not looking for a standard 9-5 role.  You want the best of both worlds: a start-up mentality with disruptive thinking, but with the security of a profitable, larger company, with a solid customer base and financial stability. You believe you have the potential to succeed.  You want to push your boundaries but acknowledge that success comes through hard work, a positive attitude, and being surrounded by a great team that refuses to sit back and wait for opportunities to come to them.


 


You will need to demonstrate that you are passionate about what you do and that you drive success in your area.  You’re a dynamic and proactive BD Manager who thrives under pressure and always takes responsibility for developing new customers and accounts.


 


Essential Skills & Experience:



  • Some successful and demonstrable experience of solution sales, through a mix of software and services

  • Takes accountability and ownership. Demonstrable track record of working autonomously to build portfolio

  • Both strategic and tactical in thinking: capable of understanding the intricacies of Public Sector engagement

  • Effective user of a CRM to drive accurate and regular customer touch point/reporting and pipeline analysis.


 


Your Style:



  • Natural self-starter: positive and confident.  Highly resilient in the face of rejection or challenge

  • High EQ: confident communicating and influencing stakeholders and colleague at all levels.  Successfully engage with both technical and non-technical colleagues/clients

  • Really great communication skills both in spoken and written English

  • The ability to work independently and as part of a team

  • High attention to detail.


 


The Benefits:



  • Training & development to support you and your career

  • A great benefits package including medical & life insurance, attractive company pension

  • 25 days holiday plus your birthday as holiday!

  • Annual company bonus scheme (company and individual bonus)

  • Subsidised gym membership, with lunchtime circuit training three times a week

  • A casual work environment and flexible working with core hours 10:00 – 15:00. You tell us how you work best including the ability to work from home

  • Regular social events including “first of the month” drinks, monthly charity days, BBQ’s and much more

  • Employee recognition awards

  • Perkbox membership to help you with your everyday purchases!

items.content:
Join the Growth Story at Envitia


We’re a software and services company on a growth trajectory with 25+ years of experience in delivering world-class location and data software and expertise to customers in the public and private sector.


Following a re-organisation last year, the company had a hugely successful 2018 – all down to an amazing group of people. We’re now looking to grow and build a team that are hungry for success. We’re creating a culture that is fun, supportive yet challenging, and we’re looking for talented like-minded people to join us on this journey. We’re also looking for people who are comfortable in challenging the norm so we can get truly diverse thinking when solving problems and not just senior management making decisions – we really believe in empowerment.


What do we do? In short, we solve complex data problems to help our customers make better and faster decisions. We do this through our team of data consultants who undertake cutting edge R&D projects or work with customers to find the best data modelling approach, architecture and standards so they’re able to make use of their data. Or, through our software products where we enable customers to search for, and then visualise, data so they have great situational awareness and can make better decisions.


 


About the Role


Here at Envitia we’re on a success curve and we’re growing our teams across the business to reflect the exceptional reputation we have as creative, nimble solution-focused consultants. This role is the very epitome of that reputation. It’s a Hunter approach, through a consultative lens. Consistently demonstrating your ability to build insightful relationships with customers, understand key problems and respond as a Trusted Advisor. You’ll be able to clearly identify and communicate the point of difference and value that Envitia brings to each unique project.  Key tasks include:



  • Build and pursue a pipeline of market opportunities in-line with the sales strategy

  • Develop new customer relationships in order to deliver profitable new business growth through understanding their needs and requirements

  • Accurately forecast sales to agreed timescales against yearly and quarterly targets

  • Lead the full sales cycle from lead generation to proposal submission, negotiation and contract award

  • Effectively develop and manage proposals, bids and quotations to secure business

  • Identify marketing & PR opportunities linked to relevant markets, customers & opportunities

  • Liaise closely with Consultants and Engineering team for opportunities

  • Maintain accurate account plans & strategies

  • Maintain accurate weekly CRM updates & customer meeting notes

  • Engage in company-wide initiatives: be an Envitia Ambassador.


This is a role that will offer you ample opportunity to develop both your business development and technological understanding of complex data solutions.  You will be working with senior experts in their field and your potential career progression could be anywhere from managing a Business Development hub to Sales Director.


 


About You


You’re not looking for a standard 9-5 role.  You want the best of both worlds: a start-up mentality with disruptive thinking, but with the security of a profitable, larger company, with a solid customer base and financial stability.


You believe you have the potential to succeed.  You want to push your boundaries but acknowledge that success comes through hard work, a positive attitude, and being surrounded by a great team that refuses to sit back and wait for opportunities to come to them.


You will need to demonstrate that you are passionate about what you do and that you drive success in your area.  You’re a dynamic and proactive BD Manager who thrives under pressure and always takes responsibility for developing new customers and accounts.


 


Essential Skills & Experience:



  • Demonstrable success of solution sales, through a mix of software and services

  • Track record of leading the full sales cycle from lead generation to contract award for £500k+ opportunities

  • Consistent sales success: achieved annual sales target in excess of £2million

  • Takes accountability and ownership. Demonstrable track record of working autonomously to build portfolio

  • Both strategic and tactical in thinking: capable of understanding the intricacies of Public Sector engagement

  • Effective user of a CRM to drive accurate and regular customer touch point/reporting and pipeline analysis.


Desirable Skills & Experience:



  • Worked in Public Sector

  • Comfortable with technical solutions and software


Style:



  • Natural self-starter: positive and confident.  Highly resilient in the face of rejection or challenge

  • High EQ: confident communicating and influencing stakeholders and colleague at all levels.  Successfully engage with both technical and non-technical colleagues/clients

  • Really great communication skills both in spoken and written English

  • The ability to work independently and as part of a team

  • High attention to detail.


 


Security Clearance Requirements


Many of our public sector customers require UK Security Clearance as a mandated requirement. You’ll need to provide proof of identity, employment history and right to work in the UK, along with proof of UK residency, for at least five years.


The Benefits:



  • Training & development to support you and your career

  • A great benefits package including medical & life insurance, attractive company pension

  • 25 days holiday plus your birthday as holiday!

  • Annual company bonus scheme (company and individual bonus)

  • Subsidised gym membership, with lunchtime circuit training three times a week

  • A casual work environment and flexible working with core hours 10:00 – 15:00. You tell us how you work best including the ability to work from home

  • Regular social events including “first of the month” drinks, monthly charity days, BBQ’s and much more

  • Employee recognition awards

  • Perkbox membership to help you with your everyday purchases!

items.content:
Digital Producer, Account Manager at Coalition Technologies

Remote | International

We seek a professional Account Manager to add to our cross-functional team. To join Los Angeles’ best SEO company you must be highly talented with a desire to work in a fast-paced, startup environment. Our ideal Account Manager is an energetic and articulate digital marketing professional with a knack for project management and excellent customer service and interpersonal skills.

Required Skills and Abilities:
  • Articulate and efficient communicator
  • Excellent written communication skills, impeccable English grammar and mechanics
  • Confident, solid conflict-resolution and interpersonal skills
  • Strong analytical and project management skills, ability to juggle multiple projects concurrently without sacrificing quality of work
  • Outstanding organizational and time management skills
  • Keen eye for detail, ability to consistently spot and correct mistakes before our final products reach our clients
  • Flexible, adaptable, able to “see the big picture”, prioritize work, and meet tight deadlines
  • Proactive, dependable, trustworthy, optimistic, can-do attitude
  • Ability to gracefully receive, discuss, and implement feedback from peers, subordinates, management, and clients alike
  • Ability to explain technical processes to a non-technical audience
  • Great work ethic, punctual, and reliable
  • Ability to work full-time: Monday – Friday, 9 AM to 6 PM Pacific Time
Preferred Skills and Experience:
  • Previous account management or customer service experience
  • Experience creating and giving professional presentations, reporting to clients, and communicating with business executives
  • Quality assurance experience
  • Digital marketing skills and experience — SEO, SEM, etc.
  • Bachelor’s degree or better in marketing, business administration, computer science, or related field
  • Front and back-end web development skills — HTML5, CSS3, PHP, and JavaScript
  • Proficiency in several of these tools: Basecamp, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, SalesForce, Hootsuite, Screaming Frog, SEOmoz, MailChimp, Microsoft Office Suite, G Suite, WordPress, Shopify, Magento, BigCommerce, etc.
  • Google Adwords and/or Google Analytics certified
Responsibilities:
  • As one of our Account Managers you will orchestrate our clients’ digital marketing services, liaising between our different internal teams — design, development, copy, SEO, SEM, social media management, etc. — to complete deliverables on time, on budget, and always consistent with client branding, voice, and marketing objectives
  • Expertly identify and solve possible issues in client accounts, digital strategy, or deliverables
  • Be our last line of defence in quality assurance, ensure that deliverables, reports, and all client communications are 100% error free
  • Lead and/or actively participate in client calls and meetings to create initial digital marketing strategy, provide status updates, give presentations, and address client concerns
  • Be our clients’ champion and liaison with our team, provide outstanding customer service, and work diligently to help us maintain our high client retention rate
  • Stay up to date and knowledgeable of clients’ business, clients’ industry, and best digital marketing practices
  • Maintain client confidentiality and ensure secure keeping of clients’ information
  • Promote additional digital marketing services
  • Address client billing issues and ensure collection of payments for services rendered
Benefits:
  • Monthly bonus plan that distributes 50% of the company’s profits among all team members
  • Paid time off that grows with your time at the company
  • Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance
  • Subsidized gym membership
  • Competitive salary
Apply for job

items.title: Sales Associate
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Our Story 


 


Founded in 2016 by Allan Baudoin and Bo van Langeveld, Baudoin & Lange designs, manufactures and sells high-end shoes for men and women.  


 


Allan Baudoin, a computer scientist and Apple alumni turned self-trained bespoke shoe maker, designed and handcrafted the first Sagan in 2014 as his own atelier shoes - hundreds of prototypes and two years of development later, the Sagan was born - instantly conquering the connoisseurs regulars of "the Row" with their supreme comfort, fit for a modern lifestyle.


 


When he and Bo van Langeveld, an ex-racing driver turned financier who was tired of suffering in his obligatory formal office shoes, met - they together developed the idea of a modern shoe brand that would combine the best of both worlds: comfort and style.


 


Our first staple product, the Sagan, is a supremely comfortable and versatile category defining loafer, featured in major publications and sold in over a hundred countries.  


 


We have been experiencing rapid online and offline growth, particularly in the US and Asian markets, where our stockists and partners range from high-end tailoring shops to the most renowned luxury department stores. 


 


To date, Baudoin & Lange benefited from compelling triple-digit organic growth; our customers are incredibly engaged with our brand and are our advocates, word-of-mouth has contributed significantly to discovery and we are one of the youngest companies to have firm partnerships with global luxury department stores (Harrods, Selfridges, Barney’s, Beams Japan etc) have been very successful.  Our social media engagement rates are high, and bloggers and influencers love our shoes! 


 


The Opportunity


 


We are looking for retail ambassadors who can communicate passionately about the Baudoin and Lange brand and provide visitors of our first central physical UK location with an amazing try-on experience. This position will be based in our Burlington Arcade pop up, near Piccadilly station. Your primary work location will be on the sales floor of London’s Historical Landmark, this area is a major tourist destination and a vibrant, multicultural gathering place in Central London. 


 


This is an opportunity for those who thrive in a fast-paced environment, see themselves as more than a Sales Associate but as a true personal ‘advisor’- someone who is seeking to grow their career in the luxury retail environment, has a strategic sales mindset, willingness to learn and a passion for forming meaningful relationships with a global clientele. As we value forward thinking individuals, we welcome someone who is eager to contribute their creativity and skill set to continue the success and strong heritage of the brand.

In order to be successful in this role you must be someone who has experience working in a luxury or high end retail environment or has a strong history involving customer service, dealing with a diverse and elevated clientele. Someone who is motivated to continuously improve personal performance, works well in a team setting, possesses elevated interpersonal skills and the curiosity to discover and enhance the customer in-store experience.


 


This is an extraordinary opportunity to protect, enhance and strengthen our retail sales activity across current and future retail locations, and to take true ownership of our new store front.  In return, we offer a chance to work in a creative and fast-paced environment, directly with the founders, through which you’ll get exposure and insight into the luxury industry with a fresh perspective.


 


About You 


 


As our Sales Associate, you will be an ambassador of the Brand, ensuring that every Client is treated according to the Baudoin and Lange promise. You will strive to discover your Clients and their every need, and to guide them across the Brand. 


 


Requirements


 



  • Promote and drive the company culture

  • Ensure store operations are functioning properly, request for maintenance if needed.

  • Execute and delegate operational tasks and productivity

  • Communicate with Retail Ambassadors specific business communications and new products

  • Ensure proper visual merchandising standards on the retail floor and windows

  • Ensure all current product is exposed on retail floor

  • Ensure customer satisfaction and resolve point-of-sale discrepancies

  • Monitor stock levels and ensure Retail Ambassadors are filling shelves

  • Assist in sales and cashiering

  • Manage day to day operations of the store

  • Work closely with Head of Sales and Store Manager to optimize in-store offering and stock management to optimize sales


 


What kind of person are we looking for? 



  • Prior retail experience desired, ideally in fashion or footwear

  • Positive attitude and enthusiasm

  • Engaging relationship building with customers with the goal of every customer leaving with a smile

  • Connection to Baudoin and Lange’s philosophy and products

  • Pride of ownership with store appearance, cleanliness and organization

  • Willingness to go above and beyond

  • Once trained, use the POS system accurately to process sales

  • Actively contribute towards meeting and exceeding the team's sales goals

  • Have a ‘can-do’ attitude, flexibility, creativity and very hands-on

  • Have excellent communication skills and established experience in presenting to senior leadership

  • Proper presentation and tone-of-voice that corresponds with our brand image


 


What We Can Do For You



  • Competitive hourly wage

  • Team of positive, enthusiastic, and passionate people

  • Duration: Fixed term 3 month contract with option to convert to full-time and opportunity to grow within the company

  • Free pair of shoes!

items.content:
Sales Associate

Tiny Boards (Owner/Operators of We Work Remotely) is hiring a Sales Associate to take control, plan and execute on outbound sales initiatives for We Work Remotely. This role is for someone with experience independently generating and closing business and is excited about taking ownership/responsibility for our sales efforts. We have done a good job (we think) of expanding our business and growing our community, but it’s time to bring someone on to help us in the next phase of our growth. We’re excited about it, and we hope you are too. 

 
ABOUT THE JOB



This job will help define the future growth of our business and continue to define We Work Remotely as the world’s #1 remote work hiring platform. For us, this role will unlock an important channel of untapped growth, while also giving the successful candidate opportunities to generate meaningful revenue for themselves with a significant bonus structure. 

By working closely and building relationships with growing remote companies, you’ll be at the forefront of the remote work revolution. You’ll learn about the unique challenges that remote companies face. At the same time you’ll work in a small, high performing team that enjoys the resources of a larger company but the independence and agility of a startup. 

Your  job consists of many things. Here are some examples of what you might be doing on any given day:

  • Outreach to remote companies based on our internal research
  • A/B testing email copy and refining our message 
  • Continual follow ups to new and existing customers
  • Maintaining relationships and building trust amongst newly on-boarded customers 
  • Gathering data and creating a profile for non converting potential customers. 
  • Working with management to create and refine long term objectives and opportunities that we might be missing. 
  • Creating a road map for the growth of our sales team in the future. 
  • Researching new and untapped sales opportunities


About you


  • You have 2+ years experience in B2B sales in SAAS or other online businesses. 
  • You have experience building sales funnel process and procedures and can give examples of successful execution. 
  • You have worked remotely and can give us examples of what you do in order to make sure you stay effective while working alone.
  • You can give us an example of what bad sales practices look like and what you’d do differently. 
  • You are a great communicator and writer.
  • You can take and give feedback candidly. 


ABOUT US




The team working on WWR is a small group of individuals who work remotely and support each other in executing on our objectives and building the business. We believe strongly in the benefits of remote work, and are passionate about spreading that message. We write a lot about it and speak about it regularly on the podcast. We act like owners and expect a lot from each other because we believe that our mission is an important one.

We don’t care how long, or where you work, as long as you get the job done. We need you to grow our business by bringing new customers to our platform in a way that is mutually beneficial for our customers. How you do it is up to you. 

You will be working as a one person sales team, which means you must be able to work effectively, adapt on the fly and define our sales process. You represent us as a business, and we take our reputation very seriously. We need you to be a good person to work with; which means you are professional, treat others with respect and help us grow. A sense of humour and a quality gif game never hurts : -)


HOW TO APPLY


If you’re interested in the role and think you can help us grow our our outbound sales process, please reach out to matt@tinyboards.co with your resume and explain briefly in the email why you’re right for the job. Also include one time where you witnessed or experience bad sales practices, why it was bad, and what you would have done differently. Keep it short and to the point. This job is restricted to Canadian applicants.

While we appreciate everyone taking the time to apply, our limited resources and the volume of applicants only allows a very short email to those who were not successful candidates. We wish we could provide more of an overview and give feedback, but unfortunately that just isn’t possible. Sorry in advance for the generic nature of these emails.

items.content:
Business Development Representative at Dollar Flight Club

Remote | Entry-level | Part-time

Job Description

Dollar Flight Club is looking for a high energy and dynamic Sales Development Representative to provide sales support for the paid partnership portion of our business. This role will be responsible for servicing outbound sales and related inquiries with a focus on engaging and qualifying all prospective customers. This role is one of the first touch points for prospects and has the opportunity to become a full funnel sales opportunity very quickly.

This team member will manage the new outbound campaigns by qualifying active buying interest and identifying critical decision makers to successfully position our partnership offerings.

Business Development Representative Responsibilities Are:

Learn how Ad sales works from the ground up and build the foundation for your career in the Sales side of any organization:

  • Identify/Research new potential paid advertising partners
  • Build outreach campaigns to engage with leads
  • Demonstrate the value of our offering through phone calls, email, LinkedIn and social
  • Diligently update our CRM (Hubspot) to stay current on leads and follow-ups

Big Plus If You Have:

Why You’ll Just Love Working With Us:

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
B2B Lead Generation Specialist at Expert Business Development

Remote | Freelance | Part-time

*** 3-5 years of B2B relationship building experience required! ***

Earning potential: $18.25 – $27.00 hourly ($18.25 hourly + Bonuses based on performance)

Job Type: Independent Contractor (minimum 20 hours per week)

Expert Business Development (EBD) is seeking talented B2B Lead Generation Specialists to join our team. Qualified candidates must have a proven track record of success in B2B outbound cold-calling to set appointments and generate leads. This position requires a minimum of 20 hours per week of availability. Lead Generation Specialists may have the ability to expand to 40 hours per week contingent on their productivity. It is a work from home position with a flexible schedule (Monday – Friday).

A Lead Generation Specialist introduces new corporate products or services to potential prospects through outbound cold-calling. Primary responsibilities involve tracking prospects, appointment setting and following up on leads the organization provides through our CRM application, based on the clients’ project needs. A Lead Generation Specialist handles the overall appointment coordination between the prospect and the client. Our seasoned Specialists are business professionals with a strong background in building B2B relationships. EBD prides itself in building long term relationships with our clients which extend beyond the conclusion of a project.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • B2B outbound cold-calling reaching C level executives in small, mid and large size companies
  • Ability to engage gatekeepers to identify and reach key decision makers
  • Initiate calls to build rapport with key decision makers to set pre-qualified appointments
  • Record and manage prospect data within a web-based CRM application
  • Meet established productivity and performance goals

Experience and Qualifications

  • Minimum of 3-5 years building B2B relationships
  • College degree strongly preferred or equivalent work experience
  • Goal oriented, self-motivated, results driven individual working remotelyfrom a quiet home office
  • Seasoned background in cold calling and lead generation incorporating our signature “Respectful Persistence”
  • Exceptional telephone sales and documentation skills
  • Strong organizational and effective time management skills
  • Professional with a high level of integrity
  • Computer proficiency is required, including experience with CRM software

Compensation

Hourly base pay ranges from $18.25 to $21.25 based on performance outcomes, documentation skills and meeting established goals. Bonuses for qualified appointments can range from $12.00 to $25.00 based on the complexity of the project. In addition, we offer the potential for quarterly performance bonuses, documentation bonuses and bonuses for exceptional client feedback. Our better performing agents can realistically make $25 an hour or more. This is an Independent Contractor 1099 position.

About Expert Business Development:

Expert Business Development is a business-to-business (B2B) relationship development company that assists its clients in developing and maintaining crucial business sales relationships. Specifically, Expert Business Development works with financial service organizations to develop sales strategies and relationship building skills, and focuses on areas like appointment setting and lead generation, database development, expert lead management, and sales process design. The clients that Expert Business Development works with include banks, credit unions, financial providers, corporations, entrepreneurial firms and vendors to banks and financial companies. Expert Business Development was founded in 1993 and is located in Bala Cynwyd, Pennsylvania. If you are interested in learning more about Expert Business Development, please visit our website www.expertbizdev.com for additional information.

Apply for job

items.title: Pre-Sales Engineer, Remote
items.content:
Vaco is a private-equity backed solutions company that provides consulting, managed services, staffing, and placement services globally. Established in 2002 by "Big 4" consulting veterans, Vaco now has over 40 offices and has worked with over 9,000 clients. We have over 6,000 consultants and been named to Inc. magazine's list of fastest-growing private companies for the past 12 years. Vaco offers boutique services with global reach.

The Vaco Cyber Security team's success relies on the trusted relationships built with our clients. We recognize the challenge organizations encounter improving security, restructuring operations and handling risk while maintaining compliance and keeping costs down. Our information security specialists work closely with organizations to provide the solutions that best match business and security objectives. As a member of the team, you will have the opportunity to utilize and expand your skills through client experience and industry training while collaborating with security professionals across industries. Our team provides the full spectrum of security services to clients including, Strategy & Advisory, Identity & Access Management, Cyber Security Operations, Managed Services, Governance, Risk, and Compliance.


Looking for an exciting career opportunity in Vulnerability Management? Instead of being another faceless resume, let Vaco advocate for you! Right now, we are looking to fill a position for our Vulnerability Management Team. With Vaco, you will have an advantage over your competition! Our information security practice maintains strong relationships with clients, connect your experience with the right consulting project-promoting your strengths to the manager while preparing you for that specific interview.


Our team will provide you with great insight about trends in the market - keeping you up to date on compensation expectations, opportunities to work on exciting, impactful projects, and opportunities for industry training and advancement. If you're an experienced, and you want to partner with the best, apply today!


Serves as a subject matter expert to the vulnerability management program for the business unit, providing procedural expertise to the program. Will work closely with the corporate vulnerability management team to identify threats and vulnerabilities to the organization and coordinate separation activities.



Job Description



This role is part of the sales team. The Pre-Sales Solutions Engineer will be responsible for developing basic technology solutions corresponding to specific pre-sales opportunities. All Pre-Sales Solutions Engineers align with both Sales and Engineering and are viewed as a consultative resource for Sales.



Role and Responsibilities



  • Collects technical customer requirements directly from Sales and/or through a customer, and subsequently develops basic solutions/designs utilizing those requirements and applying to software technology offered
  • Assists sales team in the development of complex security solutions/designs as needed and aligned to company software tech stack.
  • Develops customization needs and BRD's from the solution/design and utilizes that to create an estimate that Sales will include as part of their overall proposal.
  • Keeps Sales apprised of technical updates, and similarly keeps the Engineering and Product Development teams aware of new and/or unique technical requirements.


Subject Matter



  • Pre-sales engineer experience at a Cyber Security software company. Ideally with experience in either SOAR, Incident Management, or Cyber Intelligence.


Requirements



  • 1 or more years of experience as a Cyber Security Pre-Sales Engineer or Industry Consultant.
  • 1 or more years of either SOAR, Incident Management, SOC, or Cyber Intelligence.
  • Experience with Demisto, Anomali or similar tools a plus
  • Excellent organizational, verbal, written communication, and interpersonal skills with a high degree of attention to detail.
  • A strong network in the Cyber Security Community
  • Preferred location in the NY/NJ area a plus; remote with travel is OK
  • Information Security Certifications a plus
- provided by Dice
